descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.Job Details:Worldpanel by Kantar is the global expert in shopper behavior, offering continuous monitoring, advanced analytics and tailored solutions to inspire successful decisions by leading organizations worldwide. Worldpanel turns purchase behavior into a competitive advantage across a diverse range of markets including tech, fashion, telecoms and FMCG.ROLE’S MISSION:We’re currently looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our Data Science team and answer client question through analytical techniques.You’ll work closely to both the commercial team and the operations and global Data Science teams.Our ideal candidate should have a passion for discovering patterns from large data sets and will work with internal and external stakeholders to understand and solve the business problems.If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary by joining us!KEY OUTCOMES:- End to end production of the technical analysis in advanced analytics solutions.- Support and develop new solutions collaborating with the Global Innovation Team to provide our clients the best answer for their business question.- Explain processes and results to clients and internal teams regardless of the technical background of the audience.KEY CAPABILITIES:Your background will ideally look like this:· University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Computer Science, Mathematics / Statistics, Engineering or equivalent quantitative fields.· 3 to 4 years of confirmed experience in similar roles – Marketing Research experience would be a plus.· Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis and visualization using R.· Experience working with, and understanding of the detail behind relevant modelling techniques like clustering techniques, GLMs, decision trees, etc.· Business proficiency in Spanish (C2) and English (C1 Level Minimum required)With the following qualities:· With critical thinking and genuine passion for consumer behavior.· Proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.· Highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within technical and non-technical environments.· Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions. Permanent contract. The position can be based in our offices in Sant Cugat del Vallès (Bcn) or Madrid. Hybrid office/remote.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoUbicación:Madrid, ES, 28046Fecha: 15 ene. 2024¿Eres únic@?Entonces eres KPMG Originals. descripcion: Acerca del empleoEn @INETUM , seguimos ampliando nuestro Departamento de Data, en esta ocasión con roles SENIOR DATA ENGINEER y SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST, para proyectos estables con nuestros grandes clientes, con más de 4 años de experiencia en las siguientes tecnologías y tareas:Base de datos: Oracle, MySQL, Hbase.Lenguajes de programación: SQL, Javascript, R, Phyton y Spark.Big Data: Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Real Time (Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.).Experiencia en alguna plataforma de Business Intelligence (MicroStrategy, Qlik, Tableau, Grafana, etc.).ETL vía pyspark de datos desde un Data Warehouse Oracle y logs en XML y JSON a Datalake en HDFS, Hive y HBase.Modelos predictivos de venta, upselling, downselling, cross-selling y fuga de diferentes productos bancarios con Spark y R, aplicando inteligencia artificial.Modelos de clasificación supervisada y de segmentación no supervisada de nuevos clientes mediante redes neuronales.Desarrollo en Shiny o Dash de aplicaciones de visualización de los modelos analíticos implementados.*¿QUÉ PODEMOS OFRECERTE?:Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportadaPlan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimientoPlan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc.Flexibilidad horariaSomos un consultora digital, internacional y ágil. En la era de la post-transformación digital, nos esforzamos para que cada uno de nuestros 27.000 profesionales puedan renovarse continuamente viviendo positivamente su propio flow digital. Cada uno de ellos puede diseñar su itinerario profesional de acuerdo a sus preferencias, emprender junto a sus clientes para construir en la práctica un mundo más positivo, innovar en cada uno de los 27 países y conciliar su carrera profesional con su bienestar personal.Nuestros 27.000 atletas digitales están orgullosos de haberse certificado Top Employer Europe 2023Proporcionamos servicios y soluciones digitales, y nos estructuramos en varias áreas de negocio. En concreto, nuestra área de "Digital Consulting", es cross a toda la compañía, por lo que se trabaja para todos los sectores y son los más punteros tecnológicamente hablando. Incorpora a la organización las nuevas tecnologías y deja a las áreas verticales aquellas que ya consideramos consolidadas. Por lo tanto, es un área muy variada y en la que es muy difícil aburrirse. Eso sí, los compañeros que trabajan para "Digital Consulting" están siempre estudiando y certificándose en todo lo nuevo. Este área se estructura en: Data avanzada, Ciberseguridad, Arquitecturas de desarrollo y middleware y Smart Automation & Low Code.Únete a @INETUM 🙋‍♀️ Vive tu Positive Digital Flow.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!At Preply, we are continually enhancing the experience for both learners and tutors. To do this even more effectively, we've created a new cross-functional product squad!On one hand, we're here to empower our tutors, assisting them in delivering top-notch tutoring that enhances student retention and overall learning value.On the other hand, we aim to empower learners to keep the flame of learning alive even outside scheduled lessons. Our approach integrates lesson content into self-learning, ensuring tutors stay informed about student progress.Your primary responsibility will involve facilitating how we incorporate AI into the company. Selecting the most suitable ML modeling and generative AI tools for each specific problem and overseeing their integration within the product.What You’ll Be DoingStay ahead of AI trends and contribute to shaping the future of AI-assisted tutoring and AI-driven learning in collaboration with our cross-functional product squad.Identifying user needs and leveraging third-party AI solutions to enhance the learning experience for both learners and tutors.Writing production code and developing pipelines when needed.Evaluate the quality of technical solutions in the area of AI/ML.Partner with the squad’s Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations.Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap.Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences.Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale.Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators.Effectively communicating your findings to technical and non-technical audiences.Support the technical growth of data scientists in your team or area of speciality.Leading the way in how we use AI throughout our product team. What You Need To SucceedExtensive experience in product data analytics and at least 3 years of previous experience as a Data Scientist.Having a solid understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI.Good and broad understanding of data analysis concepts such as (but not limited to) conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field.Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.).Experience and/or interest in extracting insights, identifying patterns, and uncovering trends from large datasets.Exhibiting strong curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to identify and address underlying problems.Emphasizing a creative mindset and proactively engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.Possessing strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Nice To HaveExperience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).Experience with NLP and Voice Recognition field.Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions.Experience in the areas of recommender systems.Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field.Have mentored others before. Why You’ll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.  Diversity, Equity, And InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoQuiénes somosSomos una empresa de consultoría que ofrece servicios de consultoría, formación, dotación de personal e investigación. Apoyamos a nuestros clientes en la búsqueda de soluciones innovadoras y sostenibles, desde la aplicación del conocimiento científico en la resolución de complejos problemas de gestión hasta la transformación digital y tecnológica dentro de las organizaciones.Si quieres saber más sobre nosotros, consulta nuestra web https://www.winning-consulting.com/.MisiónNuestra MISION: Actuar científicamente con nuestros clientes, ajustando su modelo de negocio con el fin de crear ventajas competitivas permanentes. ENTREGAMOS PROBLEMAS COMPLEJOS.Nuestra VISION: Somos un equipo con experiencia consolidada en el mercado nacional e internacional en consultoría, formación, personal y servicios de investigación. Nuestra visión es que cada cliente y cada empleado encuentre en WINNING el camino a su éxito. BECOME WINNERS TOGETHERNuestros VALORES: Nos guiamos por los valores de pasión por lo que hacemos, poniendo siempre el máximo de nuestro know-how, experiencia y compromiso en cada reto, dando siempre lugar a todos para participar y comprometerse, dentro de una postura de máxima profesionalidad, respeto y equidad.PerfilDesde Winning Consulting estamos seleccionando a un Data Scientist, para el proyecto de una importante empresa multinacional afincada en Madrid.ResponsabilidadesApoyar al equipo de negocio en base a analíticas avanzadas para crear conjuntos de datos. Utilizar algoritmos de Machine Learning para encontrar información valiosa. Desarrollar nuevos algoritmos de Machine Learning para apoyar a diferentes departamentos para predecir ciertos indicadores como comportamiento de los trabajadores o desempeño empresarial. RequisitosExperiencia con SQL (deseable experiencia con Snowflake). Experiencia con Python y gran conocimientos estadísticos. Herramientas ML (DataRobot). Idiomas: Inglés (nivel alto). descripcion: Acerca del empleoNTT DATA – a part of NTT Group - is a Top 10 global IT services provider, headquartered in Tokyo, with over 150,000 employees.We deliver consulting solutions by combining specialized sectorial knowledge, our transformation management skills, and our large technology expertise (data, RPA, AI, low code, cloud, IoT, virtual reality), to keep our clients, as well as society, a step ahead in this digitally dynamic world.Everything we do is underpinned by our core values of 'Teamwork', 'Foresight' and 'Clients First'.Our shared leadership principles of Collaboration, Engagement and Curiosity help us build a community where our people are equipped with the best resources to face new challenges.We're excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist passionate about revolutionizing the Public Sector in Spain. Utilizing cutting-edge data and analytics, you'll be at the forefront of improving decision-making processes in a field that impacts lives daily.Your Impact:Diverse Clientele: Collaborate with national, regional, and local governments and International Organizations to improve public services in Education, Mobility, Employment, Security, Health, Fraud-detection, etc. Innovation Hub: Leverage AI and advanced analytics to transform public services from end-to-end.Strategic Locations: Choose from vibrant cities - Madrid, Barcelona, or Seville, with the option for remote working.Your Expertise:Educational Background: Bachelor’s/Master’s in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field. Specialized Knowledge: AI, Data Science, Business Analytics.Professional Experience: Proven track record as a Data Scientist/Statistician with experience/interest in Public Sector projects.Responsibilities:Analytics Consulting: Translate complex public services needs and challenges into actionable analytical solutions. Data Mastery: Proficient in data analysis, including descriptive/exploratory statistics and ML model deployment.Leadership Role: Manage and coordinate a dynamic team of 2-3 professionals.Skills & Proficiencies:Technical Acumen: Strong in Machine Learning, Python/R, SQL, and data visualization. Communication & Leadership: Excellent interpersonal skills paired with a knack for leadership and management.Additional Assets: Familiarity with Open Data Portals (datos.gob, INE, Hacienda) and other governmental ICT systems.Why NTT DATA Spain?Innovative Projects: Engage in groundbreaking work at the intersection of technology and Public Sector. Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development in a supportive, dynamic environment.Collaborative Culture: Be part of a diverse, inclusive team driving meaningful change.Ready to Make a Difference? Apply now and join us in shaping the future of public services with data-driven excellence!

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¡Hola Data Lover! 💙En SDG, no solo tendrás la oportunidad de formar parte de algo increíble, ¡sino que vivirás lo que significa ser un auténtico especialista en Data & Analytics!¿Estás preparadx para embarcarte en esta emocionante aventura? con nosotrxs, podrás potenciar todas tus habilidades y capacidades analíticas, tecnológicas y de negocio.¡Es hora de despegar hacia el futuro mediante el poder de los datos! Únete a nosotros y prepárate para romper las reglas y alcanzar tu mejor versión 🚀✨.Descubre el poder de SDG: líderes globales en la industria del dato 💥📊En SDG trabajamos para la mitad de las empresas del IBEX-35, pero también en multitud de compañías internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento, y desde 1994 nos hemos convertido en el socio de confianza para empresas que desean maximizar todo el potencial de sus datos.Si buscas formar parte de una compañía 100% especializada en #Data & #Analytics, ¡te estamos esperando!¿Cuál será tu misión?✍Ayudarás a los equipos de negocio a sacar más valor a los datos, identificando qué problemas existen y cómo pueden mejorar su negocio¿Cómo lo harás?Desde la definición del proceso de negocio y la búsqueda de soluciones que permitan sacar el mayor partido a los datos.Liderando pruebas de concepto para demostrar el funcionamiento de las soluciones recomendadas.Realizando análisis de datos complejos para dar recomendaciones de negocio clarasAcompañarás en todo el proceso para otorgar las mejores soluciones.¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición?👇Estudios de ingeniería Industrial, Telecos..Que cuentes con conocimientos y experiencia en proyectos usando Python y SQLQue tengas una clara vocación por analítica de datos y orientación a negocio, una de tus funciones principales será entender todo su contexto y ayudar a la toma de decisiones.Experiencia trabajando con datos ya que será tu día a día y la base de todo tu trabajo.Que seas un apasionado y quieras seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional en torno a la consultoría de negocio.Buenas habilidades comunicativas ya que estarás involucrado en la parte funcional y en el trato con cliente.Contar con mentalidad problem-solving ya que te enfrentarás a entornos cambiantes.Cómo trabajamos en un entorno global, ¡será un plus que puedas comunicarte en inglés!¿Qué nos hace diferentes? 🧐En nuestros proyectos, los datos y la tecnología son los protagonistas, te formaremos para que puedas trabajar con lo último del mercado (tenemos un área de innovación dónde impulsamos nuevos partnerships con fabricantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D).Tendrás todas las oportunidades para alcanzar tu mejor versión, con un plan de carrera totalmente personalizado en el que aprenderás por ti mismo y además, contarás con el apoyo del resto de compañerxs.Tu mismo te marcarás tus propios tiempos, semestralmente hablarás con tu responsable para compartir feedback y nuevos retos, y en base a tus resultados, habrá una revisión salarial.Somos una gran familia, desde el minuto 1 trataremos de hacerte la vida más fácil. Tanto tus compañerxs como el resto de equipo siempre tendrán una sonrisa y estarán dispuestos a ayudarte y ofrecerte todo su apoyo.Colaborarás y trabajarás en tu día a día con grandes referentes (técnicos y/o de negocio), estarán encantados de enseñarte todo lo posible y se sentirán orgullosxs de verte crecer.Con nosotros el Smartwork es posible. Vivirás una forma de trabajo en la que cada uno gestiona su propio tiempo. ¿Quieres trabajar 100% en remoto?¿Quieres un modelo híbrido?En SDG podrás elegir cómo quieres trabajar, aunque creemos que es importante ponernos cara más allá de la pantalla ¡Te esperaremos en los Afterworks!Somos una marca con propósito. Creemos que la diversidad y la inclusión ayudan a promover una cultura de creatividad, permitiéndonos superar nuevas situaciones y desafíos.Metiéndonos un poco más en temas más formales, pero no menos importantes, ofrecemos contrato indefinido, ¡queremos que te quedes con nosotrxs mucho tiempo!, salario competitivo de acuerdo con tú nivel de formación y experiencia (no te preocupes, ya qué, en la primera entrevista, trataremos este aspecto y te informaremos si tus expectativas están alineadas) y te ofrecemos una ayuda económica para gastos ocasionados por el teletrabajo.Podríamos continuar detallando que nos hace especiales, y nos encantará hacerlo en todas las fases de entrevistas. ✌️INSCRÍBETE AHORA ¡ESTAMOS DESEANDO CONOCERTE!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people’s lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B€ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? 🤝 Our culture and strong values. We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. 💪Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. 🤝Our commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionWe are looking for a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join the Logistics Data team in our Barcelona HQ.Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo’s business. Data scientists at Logistics own some of the most impactful models for the company, including our order dispatching engine, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, and all our time estimations models.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead Data Science projects that are central to the operations of the company.Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, having delivered on data science projects that have had significant impact. You have worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary. You are known in your team as a technical reference and you are interested in measurable results and high impact.THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time estimations models, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, dispatching engine improvements and optimisation.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsWork in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; lead a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, geospatial data science, reinforcement learning, statistical inference, time series analysis, mathematical optimisation.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling and SQL skills.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).Solid software engineering skills, and extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds. Working knowledge of agile development.Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesGOOD TO HAVEExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deserves🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.📚 An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoEl equipo de Data & Analytics de EY trabaja con las principales entidades financieras y aseguradoras a nivel nacional e internacional. Llevamos a cabo proyectos de Inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura.Buscamos Data Scientist que quieran unirse a nuestro equipo en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?Identificación de series de datos y variables correctas.Limpieza de datos y validación.Desarrollar y aplicar modelos y algoritmos.Análisis de datos para identificar patrones y tendencias.Interpretación de datos para descubrir soluciones y oportunidades.Comunicar los resultados usando técnicas de visualización¿Qué buscamos?Ingeniero de Informática, Matemáticas o similares.Nivel de inglés mínimo B2.Experiencia con al menos un lenguaje de programación, principalmente SQL. Conocimiento clustering, regresiones, árboles de decisión (random forest, XGBoost), algoritmos de reducción de deimensión, redes neuronales, etc.Gran capacidad de comunicación y liderazgo.Capacidad de entender procesos y buscar formas de optimizarlos.Conocimiento de las principales tendencias en el mundo del dato.¿Qué ofrecemos?Formación: Tendrás acceso a numerosos recursos de formación, desde certificaciones en las principales herramientas del mercado hasta el acceso a formación de posgrado como nuestros Tech MBA, Master en Business Analytics y Master en Sostenibilidad.Aprendizaje continuo: Desarrollarás la mentalidad y las habilidades para enfrentarte a nuevos retos.Tu defines el éxito: te proporcionaremos herramientas y flexibilidad para que puedas llegar a las metas propuestas.Si buscas una experiencia única, en un entorno dinámico y de crecimiento continuo, no dudes en inscribirte en esta oferta.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoNTT DATA – a part of NTT Group - is a Top 10 global IT services provider, headquartered in Tokyo, with over 150,000 employees.We deliver consulting solutions by combining specialized sectorial knowledge, our transformation management skills, and our large technology expertise (data, RPA, AI, low code, cloud, IoT, virtual reality), to keep our clients, as well as society, a step ahead in this digitally dynamic world.Everything we do is underpinned by our core values of 'Teamwork', 'Foresight' and 'Clients First'.Our shared leadership principles of Collaboration, Engagement and Curiosity help us build a community where our people are equipped with the best resources to face new challenges.We're excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist passionate about revolutionizing the Public Sector in Spain. Utilizing cutting-edge data and analytics, you'll be at the forefront of improving decision-making processes in a field that impacts lives daily.Your Impact:Diverse Clientele: Collaborate with national, regional, and local governments and International Organizations to improve public services in Education, Mobility, Employment, Security, Health, Fraud-detection, etc. Innovation Hub: Leverage AI and advanced analytics to transform public services from end-to-end.Strategic Locations: Choose from vibrant cities - Madrid, Barcelona, or Seville, with the option for remote working.Your Expertise:Educational Background: Bachelor’s/Master’s in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field. Specialized Knowledge: AI, Data Science, Business Analytics.Professional Experience: Proven track record as a Data Scientist/Statistician with experience/interest in Public Sector projects.Responsibilities:Analytics Consulting: Translate complex public services needs and challenges into actionable analytical solutions. Data Mastery: Proficient in data analysis, including descriptive/exploratory statistics and ML model deployment.Leadership Role: Manage and coordinate a dynamic team of 2-3 professionals.Skills & Proficiencies:Technical Acumen: Strong in Machine Learning, Python/R, SQL, and data visualization. Communication & Leadership: Excellent interpersonal skills paired with a knack for leadership and management.Additional Assets: Familiarity with Open Data Portals (datos.gob, INE, Hacienda) and other governmental ICT systems.Why NTT DATA Spain?Innovative Projects: Engage in groundbreaking work at the intersection of technology and Public Sector. Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development in a supportive, dynamic environment.Collaborative Culture: Be part of a diverse, inclusive team driving meaningful change.Ready to Make a Difference? Apply now and join us in shaping the future of public services with data-driven excellence!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescripción del puesto: At GFT we are seeking an experienced NLP specialist to lead the development and implementation of innovative natural language processing solutions for our diverse client base. In this role, you will focus on creating advanced NLP solutions for document processing tasks such as classification, named entity extraction, and summarization, as well as developing Generative AI applications like chatbots and Q&A systems. Your main responsibilities:Design and implement NLP solutions for document processing, including text classification, named entity recognition, and automated summarization.Develop advanced Generative AI applications such as chatbots, question-and-answer systems, and other interactive tools.Collaborate with clients to understand their specific needs and tailor NLP solutions accordingly.Lead the full project lifecycle, from requirement analysis and design to development, testing, and deployment.Stay abreast of the latest advancements in NLP and Generative AI to ensure the delivery of state-of-the-art solutions.Provide expert guidance and support to clients, ensuring the effective integration and use of NLP technologies in their operations. Skills will help you succeed:  Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Linguistics, or a related field.A minimum of 4 years of experience in NLP, machine learning, and deep learning.Expertise in programming languages such as Python and experience with NLP libraries (e.g., NLTK, SpaCy, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Demonstrated experience in developing and deploying NLP and AI solutions in a consultancy or client-facing role.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work on complex projects in a fast-paced environment.Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Soft Skills:  Team worker: ability to work with teams distributed geographically in different locationsProactive, motivated and willing to consolidate and develop a professional careerAnalytical, logical and critical thinking.Solid problem-solving skills: ability to identify problems and suggest mitigating and contingency actionsExpert ability to work independently and manage one's timeAbility to deal with ambiguous situationsCommitted and positive.Advisory skills Ofrecemos: Our offer:   Competitive salary Restaurant tickets and life insurance for every employee The possibility of Working from Home in a hybrid model or full remoteFlexible compensation plan, according to your needs Customized plan for professional development and training program Technical certifications Subsidized English / German / Spanish courses Flexible working hours and short Fridays Program to improve and promote a healthy lifestyle at work: a sports program and fresh fruit in the offices International work culture Discount Gympass At GFT we consider diversity as one of our main pillars and we foster an inclusive work environment based on cooperation and mutual respect. We offer equal opportunities for everyone regardless of race, cultural background, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or religious beliefs. GFT has drafted and registered an Equality Plan that outlines the measures to be taken with the aim of achieving equal treatment and opportunities between women and men within the company, and eliminating, if present, discrimination based on gender. Join our global team!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoVeeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.Join us in transforming the life sciences industry , committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.The RoleLink is a pillar in the Veeva system landscape that envisions "Connecting life sciences and key people to improve research and care." Our product offers real-time academics, social, and medical data to build comprehensive profiles. These profiles help our life-science industry partners find the right experts to accelerate the development and the adoption of new therapeutics. We accelerate clinical trials and equitable care. We are proud that our work helps patients receive their most urgent care sooner.Your work will shape the product roadmap for the entire family of Link products, especially newer products such as Link for Trials. You will design and create an end-to-end pipeline to extract predefined categories of information from big unstructured data in multi-domain and multi-lingual setups. You will have access to cloud infrastructure to develop your model and support from a team of software developers and DevOps engineers to deploy it to production.We want to develop new algorithms to redefine the industry expectations for quality vs. quantity compromise. We train ML models empowered by over 1900 curators to meet both the quality and the scale requirements. ML models complement and learn from continuous curation and scale our solutions to different regions, languages, and medical specialties.We invite you to work remotely from any area within this country. However, it's a prerequisite that you already reside in this country and hold legal work authorization without needing an employer's support.If you plan to move to this country or live nearby, we may still consider your application if you're a superb fit for the role. In such scenarios, kindly supply an extra document that outlines your impending or current location, visa status, and the reasons that make you an excellent fit.What You'll DoDevelop machine learning models at scale and in the AWS cloud to structure and analyze scientific dataAdopt the latest technologies and trends in AIUse and develop named entity recognition, entity-linking, slot-filling, few-shot learning, active learning, dense passage retrieval, and other statistical techniques and models for information extraction and machine readingDeeply understand and analyze our data model per data source and geo-region and interpret model decisionsCollaborate with data quality teams to define annotation tasks, metrics, and perform a qualitative and quantitative evaluationCollaborate with engineering teams to implement models at a terminal scaleRequirements8+ years of experience as a data scientist (or 6+ years with a relevant Ph.D. degree)Fluent in Python/Java and bashing scriptsExcellent analytical skills and data curiositySuperior communication and presentation skillsMastery in at least one framework for BigData (e.g. Spark, DASK) and one framework for Deep Learning (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch)Mastery of Machine Learning, including up-to-date knowledge of the latest ML innovations and frameworksUsed to start-up environmentsSocial competence and a team playerHigh energy and ambitiousAgile mindsetNice to HaveExperience in life/health science industry, notably pharmaBackground in clinical (trial) dataHaving published in AI space in a peer-reviewed journal/conferenceProduction-grade development SkillsCloud development, especially AWSExperience in NLP, NER, deduplication, entity-linking, graph-processing, or reinforcement learningLeadership skills and a solid network to help in hiring and growing the teamExperience in containerization, Kubernetes, or relevant distributed computing technologiesExperience with NoSQL databases, especially MongoDBFamiliarity with model registry solutions such as MLflowPerks & Benefits Work anywhere Personal development budget Veeva charitable giving programFitness reimbursementLife insurance + pension fund#RemoteSpainVeeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoEn Inetum seleccionamos un/a Analista Funcional con experiencia en Natural Adabas para importante proyecto IT dentro del área de Administración Pública.Funciones:-Experiencia en entornos HOST con Natural/Adabas.-Capacidad analítica y deductiva de necesidades y búsqueda de información tras requerimientos de usuario/negocio.-Capacidad de ser autónomo en la búsqueda y análisis de requerimientos o información.Lugar de trabajo: El proyecto requiere presencialidad en cliente ubicado en zona centro de Madrid.Horario de trabajo: De 7.00 a 15.00 horas y dos tardes a la semana hasta las 18.00 horas.SOBRE INETUM:Somos un consultora digital, internacional y ágil. En la era de la post-transformación digital, nos esforzamos para que cada uno de nuestros 27.000 profesionales pueda renovarse continuamente viviendo positivamente su propio flow digital.Cada uno de ellos puede diseñar su itinerario profesional de acuerdo a sus preferencias, emprender junto a sus clientes para construir en la práctica un mundo más positivo, innovar en cada uno de los 27 países y conciliar su carrera profesional con su bienestar personal.Nuestros 27.000 atletas digitales están orgullosos de haberse certificado Top Employer Europe 2023Únete a Inetum.Vive tu positive digital flow.Se ofrece:-Contrato Indefinido-Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada-Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento-Plan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.-Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc.-Flexibilidad horaria

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department , based in Bangkok , oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityPlease note -The role will be based in Bangkok. We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.In This Role, You’ll Get toDesign, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readinessMine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovationWork with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best qualityResearch discover and harness new ideas that can make a differenceWhat You’ll Need To Succeed4+ years hands-on data science experienceExcellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworksSignificant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or ScalaCan lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a teamGood communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environmentIt’s Great if You HavePhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systemsHands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/HadoopExperience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTAWe welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.#sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #doha #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #IT #4Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people’s lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B€ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? 🤝 Our culture and strong values. We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. 💪Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. 🤝Our commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionData Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo’s business. Data scientists at Logistics own some of the most impactful models for the company, including our order dispatching engine, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, and all our time estimations models.The Time Estimations team is tasked with training and serving real-time ML models for the duration of different milestones of an order, including the ETA shown to customers, the preparation time, and the arrival time of a courier to the pickup and delivery locations of an order. These estimations are key for optimizing our Logistics and for offering a great experience for our customers, partners, and couriers.In particular, they help us answer questions like how to match couriers and orders, when to notify partners and couriers of a new order, and what ETAs we show to our users (customers/partners and couriers). The impact you can have is massive: last year alone we were able to streamline the courier delivery by half a minute on average - saving Glovo millions of Euro in operational costs - among other key results.You'd be joining a multi-disciplinary team composed of Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Data Analysts. You would be responsible for the full lifecycle of the model development, productization, and deployment of our models, leveraging our Machine Learning Platform to streamline model training and deployment.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead Data Science projects that are central to the operations of the company.THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time estimations models, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, dispatching engine improvements and optimisation.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsWork in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; lead a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, geospatial data science, reinforcement learning, statistical inference, time series analysis, mathematical optimisation.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling and SQL skills.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).Solid software engineering skills, and extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds. Working knowledge of agile development.Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesGOOD TO HAVEExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deserves🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings 💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.📚 An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAllot is an industry leader in network security and visibility. A global growing company in cyber-security with a strong Tier1 customer base. We embrace an Agile way of working, priding ourselves on being fast, diverse and dynamic. We are real team players who are ready to go the extra mile to succeed. We believe that anyone can make an impact and together our team spirit makes all the difference. This is your opportunity to develop, professionally and personallyWhat we’re looking for:Talented Cybersecurity Data Scientist to incorporate our cybersecurity group.What you’ll do: Research and implement an identification/detection algorithms/signatures for encrypted traffic.Develop innovative models to improve the cybersecurity solutions of Allot products.Develop automation scripts and tools to aid in research and analysis tasks.What you should have: Solid competency in statistics, working knowledge of data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networksA motivated and creative problem solver, self-learning & results oriented.Experience with APIs, framework for Neuronal Network (TensorFlow, Torch)Good understanding of network architecture and protocols (e.g. SSL, HTTP).Experience with Linux environments.Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to C/C++ and Python.Desirable experienceMaster or Ph.D degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research or related technical field.2-3 years of work in Artificial Intelligence, Graph Theory, Natural Language Understanding, Machine Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, or Data Mining.

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Eres un/a gurú de los clics?¿Te consideras con una sed insaciable de innovación a la hora de plantear estrategias digitales? En nuestra agencia de medios cosmopolita, buscamos un cerebro creativo y analítico que no solo ame los datos, sino que también sea un visionario de las campañas digitales. ¡Entonces prepárate para ser nuestra próxima incorporación en el role "Programatic Expertise Consultant"!.Responsabilidades Clave (a.k.a. Tu misión, ¿la aceptas?): -¿Medición, optimización, seguimiento? ¡Check! Serás la Marie Curie o el Einstein de nuestras campañas, garantizando que cada elemento esté tan perfectamente alineado como las estrellas en el cielo. -Tomarás la batuta y liderarás con maestría la orquesta de nuestras campañas en el sinfín de plataformas digitales. ¿Integración en el plan de medios 360? ¡Pan comido! -¿Quieres dirigir el ministerio de felicidad de nuestros clientes?¡Tu misión es hacer que sonrían, incluso en sus sueños!-Si te consideras con habilidad para salir airoso/a del tetris o juegos similares seguro que:Nada se te escapa, y supervisarás el presupuesto y reportarás cualquier anomalía.Serás quien asegure que esos KPIs no sólo se cumplan, sino que se superen. ¡Haz que esos números bailen al ritmo de tus clics! Crearás estructuras de campañas en las plataformas como el DSP como si estuvieras construyendo castillos en la nube.Extrae insights y data para detectar patrones y tendencias de marketing antes que nadie.Experiencia previa y Background en la industria4+ años de experiencia en planificación de medios, con un alto grado de expertise en entornos digital y programática media (preferiblemente en anunciantes con foco performance).Preferiblemente personas con Grado o Máster en Business o del mundo del Marketing y la Publicidad.Lo que te ofrecemos: Un entorno de trabajo que es más un parque de atracciones para geeks de medios digitales. Oportunidades de crecimiento que harán que tu carrera se dispare como un cohete. Un equipo de trabajo que es más un elenco de superhéroes en acción. ¡Y mucho más!Si estás listo/a para poner el mundo de la compra programática a tus pies y hacer magia con cada campaña, ¡queremos conocerte! Envíanos tu CV, y prepárate para la aventura más emocionante de tu vida profesional Aquí, en el grupo Havas, nos enorgullecemos de estar comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades para todas las personas y de tener cero tolerancia con la discriminación. Somos un grupo con igualdad de oportunidades y damos la bienvenida a los solicitantes independientemente de su edad, sexo, raza, origen étnico, discapacidad y otros factores que no tienen relación con la capacidad de un individuo para realizar su trabajo.Debido al gran número de solicitudes recibidas, tan solo contactaremos con los candidatos/as que encajen con el perfil publicado.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout GFT GroupAs a pioneer for digital transformation GFT develops sustainable solutions across new technologies – from cloud engineering and artificial intelligence to blockchain/DLT.With its deep technological expertise, strong partnerships and comprehensive market know-how GFT offers advice to the financial and insurance sectors, as well as in the manufacturing industry. Through the intelligent use of IT solutions GFT increases productivity and creates added value for clients.Companies gain easy and safe access to scalable IT-applications and innovative business models. Founded in 1987 and located in more than 15 markets to ensure proximity to clients, the GFT team consists of over 10,000 determined talents. GFT provides them with career opportunities in all areas of software engineering and innovation.Your missionYou will design, develop, and maintain pipelines for data extraction, cleansing, and transformation.You will work with a wide variety of data (structured and unstructured) related to the product and its entire lifecycle, from the initial design phase to the sale in our different channels.You will perform the production implementation of solutions with advanced machine-learning algorithms to improve our core business processes and decisions.You will define and implement mechanisms for the orchestration and monitoring of the developed processes and applications.You will participate in test automation, CI/CD, and automatic deployment of our applications. You will help in the definition and improvement of code quality standards.You will be connected to the latest developments in Big Data and MLOps and invest time in bringing new technologies and best practices.What they expect from youTech skills they must have:Agile methodologiesDemonstrable experience in the development of machine learning models using libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or sci-kit-learn.+3 years of experience in Big Data environments.+3 years experience with PythonExperience with ETL for massive data.Experience in Continuous Integration ecosystems.Experience running projects involving Machine Learning algorithms, ideally in a cloud environment with distributed computing.Experience developing mathematical models and predictive algorithmsExperience in Unix systems (console management).Knowledge of object-oriented programming.Soft skills:Understanding of the link between technical specialties and customer requirements.Fluent communication skills.Keep abreast of market trends in technology.Solid analytical and problem-solving skills/investigating skills on technical matters.Well organized.Ability to identify problems and suggest mitigating and contingency actions.Proactive.Benefits & perksConciliation and Flexibility: Possibility of working from home hybrid/remote, flexible working days and intensive Fridays.Training and Development: Personalized plan, training programs.Social Benefits: Meal vouchers, life insurance, telecommuting support.Flexible Remuneration: Adjusted to your needs (health insurance, childcare, training, others).Relocation Package (if applicable): Financial support, counseling, visa sponsorship.Referral Program.Wellness Program: Nutrition, Physical, Mental. Discounts with Gympass.Life at GFT: Smart offices, events, value allowances, inspirational talks.International corporate culture.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob Title - Chapter Lead – Data Strategy & GovernanceWork location – Barcelona (ES) or Maastricht (NL)Work set-up – Hybrid (50% at office, 50% flexible)Are you a visionary leader in the field of data strategy and data management, with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Chapter Lead, Head of Group Data Office to lead our data strategy and data governance, to bring innovation and progress to life in our organization.The Chapter Lead is responsible for leading and developing a group of professionals within a specific area of expertise, known as a "chapter." You will play a crucial role in two main areas, managing people and playing a senior role in delivery.As a people manager, you will play a pivotal role in creating a highly engaged chapter by nurturing growth, fostering collaboration, and building a high-performance team. As a senior role in delivery, you will contribute to the success of platforms, products, or projects enabling business strategies.At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work, benefiting to our People, Customers & Communities and driving business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.Your key responsibiltiesLead a talented team of data professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence around data.Capability Management: Assessing and building current & future capabilities. Managing (internal & external) capacity and relationships. Ensuring the right utilization of chapter members.Senior delivery role: Contributing to business strategy by acting as a delivery lead, project manager for special assignment or, senior product manager.Facilitate the development and execution of a comprehensive data strategy, data governance framework, data operating model, and robust vision on a central data platform aligned with the dsm-firmenich’s objectives and growth initiatives.Lead Data Office and drive prioritization of data domains and allocation of resources. Secures and manages investment/budget for cross-domain data initiatives. Prepare data office and council agenda and ensure decisions and priorities taken at the data council are followed.Guide & support data domain Leaders across BUs/BPs with definition and implementations of their data domain, sub-domains, data strategy & data governance (e.g., data ownership, roles and responsibilities, and processes).Data Strategy and Data Architecture Alignment: collaborate closely with the Enterprise Data Architects to ensure that the data strategy translates into data capabilities and technical solutions that support the organization's data platform strategy.Promote senior sponsorship of data strategy and elevate the importance of data in the business strategyWe bringA rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose;A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;You bringProven (+/- 8 years) of experience in data management and related disciplines.Data Governance Expertise: Profound knowledge of data governance principles, methodologies, and best practices, including data stewardship, data quality, and data privacy.Strong understanding of data enablement and digital transformation strategies with the ability to drive change and foster a data-driven culture.Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Fluent in English.Experience in developing data strategy, data operating model, and data governance framework and defining best practices.Experience in formalizing principles, processes, and standards within data governance.Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologiesSolid understanding of data privacy and security regulations topics (Certification is a plus!)The application processInterested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal. For further information, please contact David van der Velden, Talent Acquisition Lead (david.velden-van@dsm-firmenich.com).Equal opportunities commitmentdsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.dsm-firmenich is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. dsm-firmenich people are as diverse as our customers. For us that includes a commitment to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.About Dsm-firmenichAs innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.Agency statementPlease note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

herramientas: ['Competition Economics', 'Consultoría de gestión', 'Economía', 'Estrategia empresarial', 'Investigación', 'Marketing', 'Mejora de procesos de negocio', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Microsoft SQL Server', 'Negociación']
descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Eres únic@?Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.¿Qué podrás hacer? KPMG España está ampliando actualmente su práctica de Economía de la Competencia. El equipo de KPMG Competition Economics en España se ha consolidado como un referente en el mercado de asesoramiento económico en materia de economía de la competencia. Nuestro equipo, integrado por 16 economistas, brinda un asesoramiento económico integral, tanto desde una perspectiva analítica como cuantitativa, a las empresas que se encuentran bajo el escrutinio de las Autoridades de Competencia por supuestas conductas anticompetitivas. Además, KPMG Competition Economics tiene una amplia experiencia en casos de reclamaciones de daños y perjuicios derivados de infracciones a la Ley de Competencia. Nuestra capacidad para comunicar razonamientos económicos complejos de manera clara es ampliamente reconocida por nuestros clientes. KPMG Competition Economics también trabaja, de forma conjunta, con KPMG Dispute Advisory & Forensic Technology, que brindan soporte en análisis financiero y evidencia digital, campos que han demostrado ser cruciales para lidiar con procesos económicos complejos. También nos beneficiamos de un amplio conocimiento sectorial y geográfico proporcionado por la red internacional de KPMG. Las responsabilidades del puesto pueden incluir:  Análisis de diferentes datos de mercado; diseñar y construir modelos cuantitativos y aplicación de técnicas econométricas.Recopilar información sobre el mercado, la industria, la empresa y la competencia.Revisar, resumir y analizar las tendencias de la industria; gestionar grandes bases de datos.Redacción de informes económicos o periciales, así como presentaciones.Se trata de un entorno multitarea basado en equipos que requiere de un trabajo preciso que es tanto cualitativo como cuantitativo y que, a menudo, debe entregarse dentro de plazos ajustados. ¿Qué necesitas saber?  Grado en Economía, Estadística o similar. Máster en Economía, Organización Industrial, Economía de la Competencia o EstadísticaExperiencia mínima requerida de 2-3 años en posiciones similares. En especial experiencia en análisis estadístico y econométrico utilizando técnicas empíricas.Conocimientos avanzados de herramientas ofimáticas (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) y de software estadístico/econométrico (STATE/E – Views/R o similar).Nivel alto de inglés, a nivel de redacción y conversación.Los candidatos deben tener la capacidad de pensar de manera analítica y crítica y tener excelentes habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita.Buscamos una persona resolutiva, con alta capacidad de organización, metódica, con especial atención al detalle, trabajo en equipo, proactividad y con ganas de aprender.¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficinaOportunidades internacionales y red de contactos globalFormación continua y plan de carrera a tu medidaSalario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible31 días laborables de vacacionesLa tarde de tu cumpleaños libreFlexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajoAcceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.
