titulo: Research Engineer - Energy optimization for 6G networks
herramientas: ['5G', 'Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)', 'Análisis de circuitos', 'Análisis de datos', 'Ciencias de la computación', 'Iperf', 'Red central', 'Tcpdump', 'Wi-Fi', 'Wireshark']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoThe i2cat Foundation is looking for an Engineer/Researcher to work on energy optimization topics within the framework of the SNS BeGREEN project https://www.sns-begreen.com/. to join the Mobile and Wireless Internet (MWI) group.The Engineer/Researcher will carry out experimental research evaluating the power saving mechanisms available in compute platforms used to instantiate 5G network functions (e.g. management of CPU states). The successful candidate will also work on the development of algorithms that can best exploit the available power saving mechanisms to minimize power consumption without affecting traffic performance.The candidates responsabilities include:Develop a testbed for evaluating energy consumption of 5G network functions on existent compute platformCarry out performance evaluation to understand impact of compute power saving mechanisms on energy consumption and traffic performancePropose and evaluate algorithms that exploit platform power saving mechanisms to reduce energy consumptionContribute to deliverables and publicationsThe Engineer/Researcher will directly contribute to BeGreen WP4, attending meetings and contributing to the project deliverables and publications. The successful candidate will collaborate with other junior and senior researchers at MWI that focus on 5G and Open RAN topics and are also contributing to the BeGreen project.BeGREEN project will take a holistic view to propose evolving radio networks that not only accommodate increasing traffic and services but also consider power consumption as a factor. We expected to obtain a mechanism that adjusts CPU power states to reduce energy consumption in virtualized UPF systems. The designed system should be portable to any x86 or ARM compute platforms.Minimum requirements:Bachelor's degree in telecommunications or computer scienceExperience with Linux systems and networkingExperience coding in PythonBasic knowledge on 5G, specially on the 5G Core NetworkBasic knowledge of network analysis tools (wireshark, tcpdump, iperf).Basict knowledge of python for data analysisGood level of EnglishDesired requirements:Experience coding in C/C++Knowledge on CPU management in Linux (c-states, p-states, power control...)Knowledge on monitoring and log tools (e.g. Prometheus, ELK)Knowledge on radio accesss networks (5G, Wi-Fi)Knowledge on the O-RAN architectureMaster or PhD in related topics will be valuedShe/he will be part of the O-RAN team within MWI-SDWN and will report to a senior researcher within the MWI team. More info about Mobile Wireless Internet group here: https://i2cat.net/research-topics/mobile-wireless-internetWho we are:The i2CAT Foundation is a non-profit research and innovation center that promotes mission-driven R&D activities on advanced Internet architectures, applications, and services. More than 15 years of international research define our expertise in the fields of 5G, IoT, VR, and Immersive Technologies, Cybersecurity, Blockchain, AI, and Digital Social Innovation. The center partners with companies, public administration, academia, and end-users to leverage this knowledge in order to meet real social and business challenges.The greatest value of i2CAT is the talent of the people who make up our human team. We enjoy a team of people from more than 13 different nationalities and work every day to create and foster a work environment where we all feel comfortable creating, innovating and growing.Want to know more? Visit our webpage! www.i2cat.netWhat will you enjoy?Work from our offices or from home, whichever works best for you. We ask for two days in person at the office to coordinate with the rest of the team.This is a full-time vacancyWe have a flexible work schedule respecting your work-life balanceReduced working hours on Fridays and in July and AugustFix + variable salaryOptional benefits: Travel pass, restaurant vouchers, nursery services support, medical insuranceAnnual leave of 27 working daysWe have fruit in the office to promote a healthy lifestyleIf you are interested, you can participate in events of your sector.You will work with a laptop. You can choose your operative system, Mac, Linux or Windows.Company social and team-building events (virtual & in-person)You can develop your own and personal training programme with our supportWe will work so that you have a career plan to promote your growth and developmentWhere will you do it?At i2CAT we already have an established ‘work-from-home’ policy for some time. You can work from home or from the office, whichever suits you best. We expect that you attend the office two days per week: one to stay connected with your team and another one to engage with other colleaguesIf you decide to come to the office, we are located in Zona Universitària, next to the Campus Nord of the UPC, within a multidisciplinary and multicultural environment. It is a very well-connected area (metro, tram, bus) with bars and restaurants around.Our offices are designed with an open-office concept where everything is light and transparency. We have a variety of workspaces so that you don't have to be at the same table all day.i2CAT is an organization committed to equal opportunities. That is why we seek to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented, and therefore explicitly encourage female candidates to apply.I2CAT is an organization committed to creating an environment where we celebrate diversity, and where we provide the dedicated support that our employees need, regardless of their disability.If what you have read sounds good to you... let’s have a coffee and we will tell you more!In case you liked it, but it is not your job offer, you may know someone else who fits perfectly and whom you would like to recommend!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoData Governance ConsultantValladolid / Madrid - SpainHybrid way of workingWould you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true social impact? Are you familiar with the use of data in cloud environments and do you know how to combine the best of both worlds to improve the business of our clients and our own? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!At Fujitsu, we are currently looking for a Data Governance Consultant to continue the growth of our team, leverage our product portfolio, and develop new data driven solutions for our customers.As our future Data Governance Consultant:You are responsible for the management of a project with high impact, the compilation of the functional documentation, and the coordination of different providers in the context of a project.You work hand in hand with a multidisciplinary group of data engineers to set up the data services, taking the value of managed dataYou are responsible for the identification of new use cases to build a data-driven organizationYou analyze, evaluate, and make use of new technologies, tools, or frameworks around data management.Your profileYou have a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science. Additionally, you have at least 8 years of experience, working on data governance projects and AWS environments.+8 years of experience in Data Governance in public administrationA certification in Data Management frameworks or tools such as DAMA, Anjana Data, Informatica, Collibra, Bluetab, or similar, or you are willing to get one.Experience in gathering requisites to implement data governance proceduresExperience in the implementation of a data governance officeExperience in leading the transformation towards a data-driven organizationExperience in driving conversations with customersExperience in the delivery of AWS based projectsFamiliarity with Agile Principles and SCRUM frameworkYou were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English, and you have the availability to work in a Hybrid way in Valladolid.Shape your world and achieve togetherWe want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.What is in it for you?When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work.About FujitsuSince being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.More information: www.fujitsu.com

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Qué estamos buscando?Actualmente tenemos un puesto vacante para un/a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Engineering que quiera unirse a GFT en nuestros proyectos internacionales. Buscamos una persona entusiasta y dinámica dispuesta a empezar y crecer en un entorno multicultural, motivador y desafiante.Tus principales responsabilidades serán:Aunque dependerán de tus conocimientos y experiencia aportada, en general las principales funciones que llevarías a cabo con nosotros serían:Desarrollar sistemas en la nube.Reconocer, identificar y documentar áreas potenciales donde los procesos comerciales existentes requieren cambios, o donde se necesitan desarrollar nuevos procesos, y hacer recomendaciones.Asegurar la capacidad de GFT para implementar y entregar la solución diseñada trabajando en estrecha colaboración con las unidades de entrega designadas.Identificar, evaluar y minimizar el riesgo asociado con la privacidad en la nube de la empresaRequisitos:Excelente conocimiento de los distintos entornos Cloud, especialmente GCP de al menos 2 años.Experiencia en migración de máquinas virtuales de sistemas on premise a nube.Conocimiento de herramientas DevOps al menos de 3 años.Conocimiento de utilización de herramientas automáticas de migración.Nivel de inglés alto Competencias personales:Trabajo en equipoHabilidades de comunicación, favoreciendo dinámicas que permitan el flujo de conocimiento, con interés tanto en aprender como en enseñar.Proactividad en la búsqueda de nuevas soluciones y mejorasNivel de inglés alto Qué ofrecemos: Conciliación y Flexibilidad: Posibilidad de trabajar desde casa híbrido/remoto, jornadas flexibles y viernes intensivos.Formación y Desarrollo: Plan personalizado, programas formativos.Beneficios Sociales: Cheques comida, seguro vida, apoyo teletrabajo.Retribución Flexible: Ajustada a tus necesidades (seguro médico, guardería, formación, otros).Paquete de Reubicación (si aplica): Apoyo económico, asesoramiento, patrocinio visas.Programa de Recomendaciones.Programa de Bienestar: Nutrición, Física, Mental. Descuentos con Gympass.Vida en GFT: Oficinas inteligentes, eventos, permios de valores, charlas inspiradoras.Cultura corporativa internacional.En GFT consideramos que la diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares fundamentales y promovemos un entorno de trabajo inclusivo basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades a todas las personas sin tener en cuenta su raza, origen cultural, sexo, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, discapacidad o creencias religiosas. GFT dispone y ha registrado un Plan de Igualdad que recoge las medidas a adoptar con el objetivo de alcanzar en la empresa la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres y a eliminar, si es que la hay, la discriminación por razón de sexo¡Únete a nuestro equipo global!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout Coesia and Volpak:Volpak, headquartered in Santa Perpetua de Mogoda, Spain, is the pioneer in the design and manufacturing of horizontal form-fill-seal (HFFS) machines for flat and stand-up pouches.Volpak's customers are market leaders in the food, beverage, chemical, personal and home care, pharma & healthcare industries.Volpak is part of Coesia, a group of innovation-based industrial and packaging solutions companies operating globally, headquartered in Bologna, Italy.Coesia has 141 operating units in 36 countries, a turnover of about 1.9 billion euros and over 8,000 employees.About the Role:Assist in the automation of Volpak’s machinery to improve, streamline and automate processes and maximising efficiency while still keeping product quality and adhering to internal protocols and external regulations.Main tasks and direct related responsibilities:Carry out the automation design of a packaging machine.Based on a standard software platform, develop customized software programs for the machine according to customer specifications (PLC, HMI interfaces & Safety).Perform the start-up process of the machine at the worksite.Develop new software platforms and implement innovative motion and automation techniques according to customer requirements.Design testing methods.Prepare the guidelines and documentation for machine operation.Complete projects by training and guiding technicians. Support the service team.Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing technical, functional, and quality goals.What You Need to Be Successful:Degree in Software / Automation / Information Engineering.At least 5 years of experience in industrial automationVery good knowledge of programing in C/C++ and JavaExperience in motion control, configuration, programming and commissioning of servo drives, and CAM synchronization.Knowledge of OMRON SYSMAC, SIEMENS SIMATIC & SIMOTION and ROCKWELL LOGIX PLC programming language based in IEC 61.131-3 standard (high level) and modular programming will be highly valuable as well.Deep knowledge in SCADA systems such ZENON & Wonderware.Knowledge in high level programming using .Net, C#, C++, Java, HTML5.Demonstrable experience in CFR 21 part11 Audit Trail and GMP 5 practices and documentation.Strong focus on innovation and software development.Good command of English and Spanish. Third language is a plus.Independent work style and leadership skills as well.Result and deadline oriented.Good understanding of customer needs.Availability to travel (max. 20%)Knowledge of Office tools: MS Word, MS Excel.
ubicacion: Santa Perpetua de Mogoda, Cataluña, España

herramientas: ['Git', 'Inglés', 'Microservicios', 'Python', 'Teoría de grafos']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoQuieres formarte y desarrollar tú carrera en una empresa tecnológica referente, con un equipo de trabajo con ganas de mejorar y desarrollarse profesionalmente? ¿Te gustaría trabajar en proyectos interesantes?El área de innovación de la compañía quiere incorporar un/a SENIOR PYTHON DEVELOPER que se una a su equipo.Estamos buscando dicho perfil para integrarse y liderar el equipo de desarrollo de un producto de alta complejidad basado en Inteligencia Artificial, participando en decisiones de arquitectura y en su construcción.Necesitamos que la persona que vaya a cubrir dicha posición tenga:Conocimientos avanzados de lenguaje Python.Experiencia en el desarrollo de Backend y conocimientos de frameworks para el desarrollo de microservicios (Django, Flask…).Buenas prácticas de la ingeniería del software para liderar al equipo técnicamenteHerramientas de control de versiones (Git).Nivel de ingles B2Conocimientos deseados:Conocimientos de Apache KafkaTeoría de Lenguajes de Programación (Grammars, Lexer, Parser, AST).Reconocimiento de Lenguaje (ej. herramientas como ANTLR)Teoría de grafos.Background en Deep Learning y Natural Language ProcessingPrincipales funciones a realizar:Construir backend microservicios basado en Python teniendo en mente alta disponibilidad y capacidad de escaladoAsegurar la calidad y las buenas prácticas.Acompañar y conseguir el crecimiento de perfiles junior¿Dónde trabajarás?Buscamos integrar este perfil en el equipo de Zaragoza, donde contamos con dos oficinas (El Trovador y Aragonia). No obstante, colaboramos con equipos distribuidos en diferentes localizaciones por lo que el modelo (teletrabajo, híbrido o presencial) lo eliges tú.¿Qué te ofrecemos?💼 Contrato indefinido desde el primer momento.🔝 Participar en proyectos destacados.📈 Revisiones de categoría y salario dos veces al año.💰 El salario dependerá de tus estudios y de si aportas experiencia laboral relacionada con la posición.💳 Ayuda flex (ayuda extra aparte de tu salario): 126 euros más al mes como ayuda al teletrabajo y a las dietas.😎 Amplia carta de beneficios sociales: seguro médico 🏥; seguro de vida y accidentes ⛑; ticket restaurante 🥘; y ventajas y descuentos en diversos productos y servicios que disfrutamos como colectivo 💸.📅 Jornada completa con flexibilidad horaria, donde el horario oficial sería de lunes a jueves de 08:30 a 18:00 y los viernes de 08:00 a 15:00. Los meses de julio, agosto y mitad de septiembre hacemos jornada intensiva, de lunes a viernes de 08:00 a 15:00.🏖 27 días de vacaciones (23 días laborales + 1/2 días de libre disposición + 24 de diciembre nochebuena + 31 de diciembre nochevieja).👩🏽‍🏫 Asignación de mentor/mentora.📝 Acceso a los cursos de nuestra universidad corporativa (idiomas, formación técnica y habilidades competenciales).🎉¡No puedes perderte nuestra mítica fiesta de verano!🌏 Ambiente laboral diverso, creativo, colaborativo y multinacional.💬 Cultura de feedback continuo.👩‍💼👨‍💼 Oportunidad de ser el arquitecto o la arquitecta de tu propio camino profesional. ¿Te unes al reto? ¡Te estamos esperando!¡NTT DATA es tu sitio! Porque hemos obtenido en España, por 8º año consecutivo, la certificación Top Employer, que nos reconoce como una de las mejores empresas en las que trabajar, gracias a nuestro compromiso por el talento. Únete a un equipo que apuesta por el desarrollo integral de sus profesionales, elige el modelo de trabajo que mejor se adapte a ti, y colabora en un entorno diverso, donde cada persona tiene su propia singularidad.#TheDigitalLovers #TopEmployer¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.Because #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.En NTT DATA Europe & LATAM creemos que toda persona es única, y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Themes.Lead and oversee the technical execution of frontend aspects in eCommerce projects.Ensure project implementation quality via meticulous code reviews, enforcing best practices, scalability, performance, andmaintainability.Ensure seamless deployments across development, staging, and production environments.Collaborate closely with project managers to decipher client needs and translate them into technical tasks.Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to enhance innovation and efficiency in our solutions.Engage in client meetings, offering high-level technical insights to non-technical stakeholders for effective communication.Contribute to the development of complex and high-level implementations.Job Requirements4-5 years of Magento 2 frontend development and define work for frontend developersCapability to estimate and define work for frontend developers.Understanding and application of OOP, design principles (KISS, YAGNI, DRY) in development practices.Basic QualificationsBS in engineering/computer science or equivalent.Magento 2 Frontend Developer Certification.Nice to haveProfessional experience with Shopify Apps.Knowledge of Magento 2 backend.Familiarity with Jenkins for continuous integration/deployment and test automation.Understanding of Docker.We offer:Flexible homeworking, reconcile your personal and professional life as you wish!Very (very!) flexible telecommuting policy.Access to the Company's Flexible Remuneration Plan.Birthday off! Plus 24th and 31st December.Development plan adapted to your profile and professional interests.Possibility of taking part in international projects.Participation in sector events.Excellent working environment.Intensive working hours on Fridays and in summer (July and August).We are marketing, S.L. will process your data received through the platform, as data controller, in order to manage the selection process in which you have applied on the basis of the application of pre-contractual measures of article 6.1. b) of the GDPR. We may also ask you for your consent to keep your CV for future recruitment processes if your profile is of interest, based on the consent of article 6.1. a) of the GDPR. We are marketing, S.L. will not communicate your data to third parties, unless legally obliged to do so. You can also exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, opposition, limitation of processing, portability, and not to be subject to automated individualised decisions or consult additional information about the processing by sending an e-mail to dpo@wearemarketing.com.

titulo: Senior Consultant - Open Innovation (OCTANTIS TECNALIA GROUP SLU))
herramientas: ['Consultoría de innovación', 'Desarrollo comercial', 'Ejecución de proyectos', 'Elaboración de propuestas', 'Gestión de relaciones con clientes (CRM)', 'Inclusión social', 'Inglés hablado', 'Orientación a objetivos', 'Overseeing Projects', 'Project Supervision']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescripción de la ofertaBuscamos personas profesionales altamente motivadas para desarrollar todo el potencial de la tecnología para abordar los retos de nuestro tiempo. Trabajarás junto a las empresas para abordar sus retos de transformación y desarrollar nuevos negocios y también colaborarás directamente con equipos de TECNALIA y otros centros tecnológicos, actuando como puente para desarrollar el potencial de negocio de capacidades tecnológicas.Qué harásDiseño, ejecución y/o supervisión de proyectos de consultoría.Gestión directa de la relación con clientes, tanto para la ejecución de proyectos como para la identificación de nuevas oportunidades.Desarrollo comercial con potenciales clientes o con clientes existentes, incluida la elaboración de propuestas de colaboración.Participación en el desarrollo y crecimiento del equipo, tanto en proyectos como en acciones de formación y mentoring, así como colaboración en funciones de captación de talento.Qué te ofrecemosTrabajar en OCTANTIS TECNALIA GROUP SLU supone una aventura apasionante porque nuestra misión última es contribuir a una vida mejor para todas las personas a través de la investigación y la tecnología que genera impacto. Y esto lo hacemos en un contexto global y moderno.Ofrecemos un salario competitivo, con variable en función de resultados y horario de trabajo flexible, de acuerdo con las necesidades de negocio. Creemos en la libertad responsable y el compromiso con el equipo. Trabajamos duro, pero también valoramos pasar tiempo de ocio juntos.Todo esto se traduce en grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional. Los proyectos se sustentan en la capacidad profesional de cada miembro de nuestro equipo. Por eso, la captación de talento y el desarrollo profesional a través de proyectos e iniciativas innovadoras es una actividad primordial en nuestra labor diaria.Requisitos:Qué necesitamosTitulación universitaria, valorándose positivamente perfil académico mixto que combine titulaciones técnicas (ingeniería, ciencias, etc.) y de negocio (ADE, MBA, etc.).Experiencia de 5 a 10 años en consultoría de innovación y tecnología. Se valorará la experiencia en proyectos de ámbito tecnológico en empresas industriales en la Comunidad de Madrid.Contrastada experiencia en captación y desarrollo de oportunidades.Experiencia contrastable en gestión de clientes, proyectos y equipos.Conocimiento Avanzado en materias como corporate venturing, aceleración de negocios, emprendimiento y lean startup, innovación abierta, innovación tecnológica, modelos de negocio, design thinking, Technology Road Mapping, etc.Nivel alto de inglés hablado y escrito. Se valorará positivamente el dominio de otros idiomas.Iniciativa y proactividad, con alto nivel de autonomía y orientación a objetivos.*Valoramos positivamente las solicitudes de personas con certificado de discapacidad igual o mayor al 33%, en cumplimiento de la legislación vigente, Ley General de Derechos de las Personas con Discapacidad y de su inclusión social (LGD).

herramientas: ['Banca', 'Economía', 'Español', 'Gestión de pérdidas y ganacias', 'Inglés', 'Mercado de capitales', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Murex', 'Resolución de problemas', 'Trabajo en equipo']
descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Quiénes somos?Optimissa es una empresa de consultoría IT especializada en Financial Services, siempre en búsqueda permanente de los mayores entusiastas de la Consultoría.Intentamos reinventarnos constantemente para así poder ofrecer el mejor lugar para que nuestros colaboradores puedan desarrollar su carrera y la mejor alternativa como partner para nuestros clientes. Desarrolla tu carrera y escribe tu propia historia.Nuestros ProyectosSe caracterizan por un alto grado de complejidad, realizando labores de arquitectura, análisis y desarrollo. Construimos aplicaciones ad-hoc y producto propio para áreas de inversión de las principales entidades financieras.En esta ocasión queremos incorporar en nuestro equipo a un Consultor especializado en Murex con Perfil Cuantitativo para sumarse a nuestros proyectos de Corporate & Investment Banking.100% Remoto (Indispensable residencia fiscal y permiso de trabajo en España).Poder trabajar en español (nativo o alto) e inglés (intermedio-alto).Requisitos:Ubicación: España. Tener residencia fiscal y permiso de trabajo en España (el contrato se firmará en España aunque el trabajo se realizará 100% en remoto).Idiomas: español (nativo o alto) e inglés (intermedio-alto. Sobre todo escrito).Perfil cuantitativo: Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería o Economía.Muy Deseable: Posgrado en Productos Financieros / Riesgos / Finanzas Cuantitativas.Al menos 4 años de experiencia continúa y reciente en tareas de configuración metodológica de Murex, con réplicas de los distintos cálculos de Murex en Excel (P&L, Sensibilidades, PLVA).Soft Skills: resolución de problemas, proactividad, trabajo en equipo.Ofrecemos:Incorporación estable - Contrato IndefinidoProyectos y Servicios a largo plazoExcelente ambiente de trabajoPlan de carrera profesionalSalario negociable según experienciaPlan de Retribución Flexible: combinación de salario base + beneficios que se adaptan a tus circunstancias (Ticket restaurant, seguro médico, ticket transporte)Modalidad de trabajo: En remotoSi has seguido leyendo hasta aquí, cumples los requisitos....¡Únete a Optimissa!

herramientas: ['Programación en C', 'Python']
descripcion: Acerca del empleo¡Bienvenido/a a Binaia! 😊En Binaia somos una empresa de Headhunting y Formación especializada en perfiles IT, donde trabajamos un depurado modelo de Headhunting & Recruiting, centrándonos en conocer tus intereses y expectativas, y en base a ello, ofrecerte un proyecto que se ajuste al máximo a tu ideal profesional 👬Nuestro modelo ya funciona en las diferentes empresas tecnológicas del grupo Bosonit con quien colaboramos, donde contamos con proyectos muy variados: Data Engineering, Software Development, DevSecOps, IoT, CRM, ERP, Robotic, Mobile, etc. 💻El Grupo se completa con una iniciativa de aceleración de negocio gracias a:The Wick, una aceleradora de empresas de producto tecnológico del que ya han nacido 8 Start Up 🏢 Allí ha nacido Elliot Cloud, uno de sus productos estrella que hoy ha llegado más allá.🎯¿Qué estamos buscando?Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Software Test & Validation Engineer. Como miembro del departamento de sistemas electrónicos, validará el software de nuevos desarrollos para motores electrónicos y unidades de control para asegurar su correcto funcionamiento, reportando directamente al Director de Sistemas Electrónicos.Requisitos indispensables:Modalidad de trabajo: Hibrida (Abrera) 4 días presencial y 1 día en remotoNivel de inglés avanzadoEstudios en Ingeniería Electrónica, o similar.Al menos 2 años de experiencia en puesto similar.Conocimientos de lenguajes C o Python.Experiencia con herramientas vectoriales (protocolos de comunicación CAN, LIN).Requisitos deseables:Conocimientos de la norma ISO 26262 de seguridad funcional en automoción.Conocimientos de Altium para la consulta e interpretación de esquemas y trazados.Conocimientos de programación e instrumentación LabVIEWExperiencia en implementación de FCT, ICT y verificación EoL para HW.Tus tareas serán:Realizar estudios sobre pruebasDiseñar, definir, desarrollar y ejectuar pruebasDocumentar pruebasColaborar estrechamente con el departamento de ingeniería de productos electrónicos.📌 Ofrecemos:Horario flexibleModalidad de trabajo hibridoCompañía en crecimientoPaquete de beneficios personalizable¡Esta es tu oportunidad!Si deseas obtener más información puedes consultar los siguientes enlaces:· https://binaia.es/ https://bosonit.com/ https://thewick.es/ https://elliotcloud.com/ https://docexploit.com/ https://graphenus.io/

herramientas: ['Administración pública', 'Amazon Web Services (AWS)', 'Análisis de datos', 'Diseño de prestaciones', 'Gestión de proyectos', 'Gobierno de datos', 'Inglés', 'Metodologías ágiles', 'Project Resource Allocation', 'Scrum']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoData Governance Project ManagerValladolid / Madrid - SpainHybrid way of workingWould you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true social impact? Are you familiar with the use of data in cloud environments and do you know how to combine the best of both worlds to improve the business of our clients and our own? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!At Fujitsu, we are currently looking for a Project Manager to continue the growth of our team, leverage our product portfolio, and develop new data driven solutions for our customers.As our future Project Manager:You are responsible for the management of a project with high impact, the compilation of the functional documentation, and the coordination of different providers in the context of a project.You work hand in hand with a multidisciplinary group of data engineers to set up the data services, taking the value of managed dataYou are responsible for the identification of new use cases to build a data-driven organizationYou analyze, evaluate, and make use of new technologies, tools, or frameworks around data management.Your profileYou have a Bachelor degree in Engineering, Computer Science. Additionally, you have at least 8 years of experience, working on data exploitation and the development of (advanced) analytical models within the cloud environment, specifically in AWS.+8 years of experience in the management of data projects+8 years of experience in Data Governance in public administrationExperience in resource allocationExperience in gathering requisites to build technological solutionsExperience in driving conversations with customers and leading a technical teamExperience in the delivery of AWS based projectsFamiliarity with Agile Principles and SCRUM frameworkYou were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English, and you have the availability to work in a Hybrid way in Valladolid.Shape your world and achieve togetherWe want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.What is in it for you?When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work.About FujitsuSince being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.More information: www.fujitsu.com

herramientas: ['Análisis financiero', 'Balance contable', 'Elaboración de informes financieros', 'Elaboración de presupuestos', 'Estados financieros', 'Finanzas', 'Informes anuales', 'Murex', 'Operaciones financieras', 'Trabajo en equipo']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoThis project consists of the full automation of the Markets Business Book monthly and daily elaboration process. We are looking for a resource to help validate that the final output, focusing on information at deal and portfolio level delivered on the IT tool (FMIS – Profitability) is aligned with the inputs previously reported in the origin systems that feed into it. The main functions include: Performing UAT testing and reconciliation of financial systems input information (by business areas, portfolios, products, etc.).Elaboration of monthly comparative analysis of Balance Sheet and Income Statement between output reported in technological system (FMIS - Profitability) and origin systems (Murex, etc.), escalating outstanding differences and proposing the necessary improvements to guarantee correct information flows for Treasury, Finance, and Front Office. Candidate must have worked or have knowledge of financial/ MI reporting (preferably with Murex), should have experience managing large databases, and have advanced knowledge in handling PowerBI. Strong Programming skills are a plus. Fluency in English is a must as will be working with our European offices.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionRole Overview: As an Analyt, Data Engineering, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions.  You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools.  You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics Day-to-day: Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business.  Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.  Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.  Deliver of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.  Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.  Design and Build Data Service APIs.  Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.  Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.  Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes. Key Technical skills Data Lake Store  Azure Data Factory  Azure Blob Storage  Azure SQL DB  Azure Synapse Analytics  Azure DataBricks Preferred Education BackgroundYou likely possess a bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or another relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.Work experience:You likely have between 1 to 3 years of relevant experience.¿Wanna know more about us? 💻 Flexible schedule  🏠 Possibility to work 100% remotely  🎉 Days off during Christmas and Easter.  🩺 Medical insurance.  💰 Variable and flexible remuneration.  🌱 Microsoft certification and training in soft skills  🏳️‍🌈 LGTBIQA+ Friendly Environment If you want to know more about our benefits, check this link¿Are You interested in us? ¡Sign up bellow!About AvanadeAvanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIngeniero de Software I+DARDANUY INGENIERIA S.A. es una empresa consultora de ingeniería con 30 de experiencia en el sector ferroviario. Cuenta con una plantilla de más de 300 empleados y 30 M de Euros de ventas en 2023. Las oficinas principales de la empresa en España se encuentran en Barcelona, Madrid, Valencia, Sevilla y Tenerife. Tiene empresas filiales en Lituania, India, Argelia, Perú, Colombia y Brasil.La empresa está especializada en proyectos y direcciones de obra de infraestructuras y sistemas ferroviariosDeseamos incorporar un ingeniero de software I+D para desarrollar las siguientes funciones:Coordinación y Dirección de Equipos para desarrollo de software.Documentación de software existente.Desarrollo de nuevo Software e Integración, Bases de Datos, Interfaces gráficas.Desarrollo algorítmico y simulación de sistemas físicos (mecánica, electricidad, telecomunicaciones/señalización).Ofrecemos:Puesto de trabajo estable con condiciones laborables atractivasBuen ambiente de trabajoDesarrollo profesional constante con plan de carrera vertical y horizontalRequisitos mínimosGrado de Ingeniería Informática, especialidad Computación (preferentemente). Otros perfiles: Ingeniería Informática (otras especialidades), Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones, Ingeniería Industrial, Matemáticas, Física, Ciencia e Ingeniería de Datos, otras Ingenierías con conocimientos de software.Imprescindible conocimiento de inglés.Requisitos deseadosMáster de Ciencia o Ingeniería, preferentemente con conocimientos de desarrollo de algoritmos y software.1-3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de software y desarrollo de algoritmos (perfiles que no vengan de Ingeniería Informática).Inglés nivel B2 o C1, o equivalente (muy deseable).

descripcion: Acerca del empleoEn INETUM estamos creciendo y nos gustaría ampliar nuestro equipo de Técnicos de Seguridad para dar servicio a un importante cliente del sector transportes.¿QUÉ HARÁS?Dando servicio en los diferentes centros que tiene el cliente en Madrid, te encargarás del mantenimiento de grabadores y cámaras analógicas; así como del mantenimiento de las alarmas.¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS?- Estudios de FP en Electricidad, Electrónica o Mantenimiento.- Experiencia dentro del sector de la seguridad electrónica, en los campos de intrusión y CCTV.- Imprescindible tener carnet de conducir.¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?- Contratación Indefinida- Posibilidad de crecimiento dentro del sector.- Salario según convenio¿QUIÉNES SOMOS?Inetum es una compañía de servicios ágil que proporciona servicios y soluciones digitales y un grupo global que ayuda a compañías e instituciones a aprovechar al máximo el flow digital. En un contexto de continuo movimiento, en el que las necesidades y los usos se reinventan constantemente, el grupo Inetum se compromete con todos esos actores a innovar, seguir adaptándose y mantenerse a la vanguardia. Con su perfil multi-experto, Inetum ofrece a sus clientes una combinación única de proximidad, organización sectorial y soluciones de calidad industrial.Presente en más de 26 países, el Grupo tiene cerca de 27.000 empleados y en 2019 generó unos ingresos de 2.300 millones de euros (pro forma).

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt ECB Group we have been dedicated to the search, evaluation and selection of highly qualified professionals for more than 10 years. We have an international presence, with the capacity to manage projects on 5 continents.We are looking for a Software QA Engineer to join the team of a large international company in the renewable energy sector. descripcion: Acerca del empleoSi tienes experiencia en ámbitos de cibersecurity y estás buscando un nuevo reto profesional para especializarte en el área de seguridad IT, nos encantaría presentarte esta oportunidad:Este puesto de trabajo está hecho para ti si:Experiencia en seguridad en cloud.Análisis, KPIs, OKRs relativos a ciberseguridad.Experiencia y conocimientos DevSecOps.Amplia experiencia en la gestión de herramientas de seguridad activa y pasiva tales como Firewalls, EDRs, SIEM, Gestión de claves, IDS/IPS, etc..Conocimiento de los principales estándares de seguridad.Conocimientos en estándares/certificaciones NIST, ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, ENS …Conocimientos y experiencia en gestión de tecnologías colaterales como SOAP, REST web services, AD, LDAP, OAuth, WAF, programación básica, etc.Trabajar con nosotros te aportará:Participar en proyectos desafiantes en un entorno dinámicoPosición estable con plan de carrera dentro de la empresa.Tendrás contratación indefinida desde el primer momentoDispondrás de retribución flexible y ticket restaurant entre otros beneficios.Si te interesa la oportunidad y conocer todos los detalles, no dudes en aplicar al puesto para que podamos contactarte y hablar mejor sobre la posición, darte todos los detalles y resolver cualquier duda que te pueda surgir.

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Quieres vivir la experiencia de una Multinacional con el dinamismo de una Startup?Si estás buscando unas prácticas que pongan a prueba tus habilidades e impulsen tu carrera, nuestro Schneider Trainee Program es para ti.   Forma parte de un ambiente inclusivo en el que podrás cocrear soluciones a retos clave de la industria aprendiendo de nuestros expertos.Lleva tu creatividad e innovación a otro nivel mientras disfrutas de unas prácticas remuneradas con horario flexible y workshops interactivos.   Únete a nuestra #SEGreatPeople Descripción del Departamento/Proyecto: La misión del departamento es ofrecer soluciones de alto valor añadido para las Infraestructuras de soporte de la Industria del Data Center.Únete a un equipo en el que aprenderás: Diseño y construcción de un Power Module o un IT Module para un cliente estratégico en el que podrá aprender:Diseño y construcción de Data Center Prefabricados con proceso BIM 3D y REVIT.Diseño de esquemas eléctricos con redundancias N, N+1, 2NTecnologías de UPS y BateríasTecnologías de refrigeración con freecooling de SchneiderSistema de monitoreo y control con Automation Server de SchneiderSistemas de protección al fuego para sistemas de misión críticos de Johnson ControlsSporte a Project Engineer para revisar diseños de los especialistas.Como configurar un BOM de detalleComo hacer la selección de equipos junto con el PE y los especialistasDimensionamiento del módulo en 3D, acotaciones, revisión de planos junto con especialistas y PE.Revisión de las estructuras con especialistas y contratas en fabricaComo dibujar en REVIT y poderlo ver en una plataforma colaborativa llamada BIM360.¿Eres a quién buscamos?  Estudiante de grado o máster en Ingenieria Industrial, Ingenieria Electrica o similarPoder realizar entre 4 y 6 horas diarias (lunes a viernes) y tener disponibilidad por las mañanas, el horario es flexible y puedes entrar entre las 8 y las 10h.Poder realizar un convenio de prácticas con tu universidad o centro de estudios por un periodo de 6 meses.Inglés altoExtroversión y ganas de aprenderConocimientos de Excel, Word, AutoCAD, REVIT (seria un plus)Participando en nuestro Trainee Program obtendrás: Una experiencia especialmente diseñada para tu aprendizaje y desarrolloPrácticas remuneradas (en función del horario que establezcas, mín. 20 horas y máx. 30 horas por semana, 700-900€/mes)Seguimiento de tu evolución y aprendizajeFlexibilidad horaria para compaginarlo con tus estudiosUn día de libre disposición al mes (acumulable)Posibilidad de colaborar en remoto según el puesto (hasta 2 días por semana)Duración de 6 meses con posibilidad de prorrogar o contratación*Como empresa siempre nos guiamos por nuestros valores corporativos, orientándonos al cliente, siendo disruptivos con el estatus quo, abrazando perspectivas diferentes y aprendiendo continuamente. Queremos que nuestras personas reflejen la diversidad de las comunidades en las que operamos. Damos la bienvenida a las personas tal y como son, creando una cultura inclusiva donde todas las formas de diversidad son vistas como un valor real para la compañía.
ubicacion: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Cataluña, España

herramientas: ['Comunicación', 'Diseño de soluciones técnicas', 'Liderazgo de equipos']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoComparte tu experiencia como Analista Funcional en un proyecto de parques de atracciones.En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Analista Funcional, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!¿Qué buscamos?Experiencia en gestión integral de requisitos.Experiencia en análisis de procesos.Experiencia en diseño de soluciones técnicas.Nivel de inglés alto.Interés en modalidad híbrida en Madrid.¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.Retribución competitiva.¿Quiénes somos?Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 3.650 millones de euros, contamos con 52.700 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoACCIONA, en su línea de Negocio de Ingeniería, busca incorporar en sus oficinas de Madrid un/a becario/a para el Departamento de Geotecnia y Cimentaciones, que desarrollará las siguientes funciones:Análisis de la información geotécnica referente a problemas concretosColaboración en la búsqueda y propuesta de soluciones a problemas geotécnicosColaboración en la realización de cálculos geotécnicosComprensión y aprendizaje de software geotécnicoColaboración en la redacción de informes técnicosTitulación: Grado y Master de Ingeniería de Caminos, o Ingeniería Geológica.Disponibilidad de:Poder firmar Convenio de prácticas con la universidad.Incorporación en enero de 2024Realizar una beca de 6 meses a media jornada o a jornada completa.Idiomas: Nivel alto de inglés (mínimo C1). Valorables otros idiomas.Interés en trabajar en un entorno multinacional y con proyección a movilidad internacional¿Qué esperamos de ti?Buscamos personas con un alto potencial, capacidad de trabajo en equipo y motivación por crecer dentro de una empresa internacional. Si crees que este es tu perfil y estás buscando impulsar tu futuro en una carrera que genere un impacto positivo en el planeta, has venido al lugar correcto… ¡te queremos en nuestro equipo!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoLocation : Barcelona, SpainAbout AizonAizon is an AI software provider that transforms manufacturing operations using advanced analytics, artificial intelligence, and other smart factory technologies. Our mission is to improve global health in order to change patients’ lives. We aim to do that by optimizing the way medicines are manufactured so that pharma and biotech companies can provide patients worldwide with the right medicine at the right time and at the right price. titulo: Supply Chain Management Traineeship Programme (SMT) - Spain - Canary Islands
herramientas: ['Administración de la cadena de suministro', 'Administración logística', 'Dirección general', 'Formación', 'Gestión de suministros', 'Inglés', 'Liderazgo', 'Negociación', 'Productos SAP', 'Resolución de problemas']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoSeniority Level:Supply Chain Management Traineeship Program 2024Launch Your Career with AB InBev: Supply Chain Management Trainee ProgramWhat is it? Our Supply Chain Management Trainee (SMT) programme is a6-month program starting in August 2024 3 different projects, lasting 4-6 weeks each, within the country you are applying for. As a junior talent, you will build your leadership, project and general management skills, and gain a 360° view on our Supply Chain. You will have a 70-20-10 learning and development approach, where 70% Learning on the Job, 20% Exposure to Other, 10% Formal Learning & Training You will be based in our breweries or logistics operations, where you will have hands-on experience in producing the beers, we are famous for, learning first-hand both the technical and practical challenges that affect different departments, including - Logistics, Quality, Packaging, Brewery Operations and People Who are we looking for? We are looking for individuals with a strong problem-solving and results-driven mindset that are passionate about a career in Supply, Logistics and Procurement. We are looking for leaders that want to optimize processes – so if you have undertaken some form of leadership position either inside or outside of university, you might be a good fit for this programme.The following qualities describe you: Bold. Proud Owner. Agile Learner. Collaborator. Problem Solver. Resilient.To be eligible: You must have graduated (before September 2024 and no more than two years prior) with a Bachelor's, Master's (or equivalent) degree from any of the following disciplines: Engineering (ideally Chemical, Mechanical, Production or Electrical), Natural Sciences (e.g. Physics, Chemistry, Bio-Sciences), Brewing or Food Science or Supply Chain Studies. You should also have no more than 2 years of professional experience (internships/volunteers/student jobs not included). Fluent English is needed, as well as the native language of the country you are applying in. A valid permanent visa/work permit is required in the country of application to be eligible for the programme. During the 6-month program and beyond, you might be required to travel within your country of application and across Europe. We are looking for: Junior talent. Recent Graduate. Junior Supply Chain Manager. Logistics Trainee. Professional Trainee. Graduate Trainee.How can you apply? Before you apply, check more information https://europecareers.ab-inbev.com/programmes/supply-management-traineeship-programme Please be advised that you will only be considered for the first application you submit, therefore please make sure you are completely happy with your choice as this decision is final. There is no need to upload a cover letter – this will not affect your application. Good to know Upon successfully completing the traineeship, you will pursue a rewarding career within our Supply Chain Departments. Therefore, your first position after the program will be located at the core of our Supply Chain, stepping into a first leadership experience in our brewery/ logistics operations. This programme is rooted in our culture and company strategy, providing experiences in life on the front-line of a brewery, working with our operators to make the beers we're famous for. At AB InBev, dreaming big is what we do. Brewing the world’s most loved beers, building iconic brands like Budweiser, Stella Artois, Corona and crafting meaningful moments are what inspire us. We are a team of passionate owners who are not afraid to dream big because we know that together, we can achieve anything. To build a more sustainable, inclusive and rewarding future. Turning any challenge into an opportunity. So, let’s take on the challenge together. Cheers to dreaming big. Next to a competitive base salary, we put our people first by providing additional benefits: Learning & Development opportunities (LinkedIn Learning/ Workday Learning/Mentoring) Vouchers to taste our delicious beer Competitive Performance Bonus after successful completion of the Programme Wellbeing support Initiatives Extended parental leave policy Pension contribution Life Insurance ZoneEUR
ubicacion: Sant Joan les Fonts, Cataluña, España

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIt takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.How To Contribute To Our VisionMain responsibilities of the position are:Responsible of design for reliability process, by defining and assessing reliability requirements for new products designedDefine the deliverables in our New Product Development process for each project gates, descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescriptionNOATUM, part of AD Ports Group, is a leading multinational group specializing in maritime, global logistics and port operations with 60 years of experience. We have successfully integrated our activities into three main business areas: maritime services, logistics and port terminal operations. Our main value proposal is the cross-cutting nature of the services we provide through our three core areas: maritime, logistics and port terminals. Today, NOATUM is renowned for its service excellence and specialized and reliable staff who have made the company a benchmark in the sector. This committed team of over 4,200 professionals has built up a diversified group of companies, covering all their customers’ needs in maritime transport and logistics areas.NOATUM’s /AD Ports Internal Audit team assists NOATUM/AD Ports ’s Board of Directors, Audit Committee and Senior Management by assessing the adequacy and effectiveness of the internal controls over financial reporting, effectiveness and efficiency of operations, and compliance with laws and regulations, as well as the adequacy of the company's risk management and governance processes. Internal Audit also provides advisory services associated with emerging risks and change activities. The function adds value by providing objective, timely and relevant analyses, insights, and recommendations by supporting an integrated, risk-based auditing approach.NOATUM Internal Audit Function currently has an opening for a  Internal Auditor. Main FunctionsAssisting the Internal Audit Team in executing NOATUM’s audit plan and participate in the day-to-day execution of internal audit.Develop understanding of procedures, policies, legislation, and regulations and ensure they are correctly followed and complied with.Participate in operational/financial audits and other type of project/program reviews to identify and evaluate key operational risks and effectiveness of related controls. Provide quality audit engagements through effective planning, fieldwork (detailed and efficient interviews and control testing), insightful audit findings, and timely draft reports.Perform audit tests and prepare working papers in accordance with professional IIA standard and internal audit methodology.Ensure adequate documentation exists to support the audit work performed in accordance with profession standards.Ensure observations are tracked and corrective action plans properly address audit recommendations with adequate remediation timelines. Provide regular status updates to IA management and business stakeholders by communicating progress on corrective action implementation.Support Internal Audit Management to partner with process owners on corrective action activities related to non-compliances and process improvement (i.e., share leading practices, collaborate to identify pragmatic solutions), promoting the role of Internal Audit as a Strategic Business Partner.Promote high levels of ethical awareness. Notify audit management of any findings related to potential ethical issues or conflicts of interest and support the department’s independent investigations, as needed. We OfferBeing part of a young, dynamic team with global impact.Continuous training thanks to our Corporate University.Afternoon off on your birthday.The possibility of having a real impact on business decisions.A role with many possibilities for professional and personal growth.A diverse work environment, with daily contact with people from different countries.Participate in the definition of the finance function at a global level.At Noatum we guarantee equality and non-discrimination on the grounds of sex, gender, race, religion, disability, age and sexual orientation in our selection processes, in order to make the best use of people's abilities in all their diversity, avoiding any kind of discrimination.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance or related field. Masters preferred.2-3+ years of public accounting and/or private industry experience with knowledge of accounting, finance and internal control areas.Certified Public Account (CPA/ACCA or ACA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), or Certified Fraud Examiner preferred.Strong Excel skills critical.Advanced level in Spanish and English (C1).Travel Requirements: 30%.Knowledge, Skills And QualificationsRisk-focused external or internal audit experience with strong ability to understand and review operational, financial and automated risks and controls within business processes in an integrated fashion.Understanding of the technical aspects of accounting and financial reporting, and professional standards (IFRS, and the Professional Practices Framework of the IIA), including knowledge of emerging topics.Good knowledge of risk management principles and an understanding of relevant standards like COSO 2013.Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively present to peers and management are essential, including the ability to build relationships, manage confrontation with poise and confidence, and communicate findings in emails and reports (written in English) in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.Good critical thinking skills, including the ability to quickly assimilate new information, identify patterns, and develop creative solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.Demonstrated good analytical skills, including ability to analyze business and financial activities, quantify impact, and understand/describe process flows, strengths, and weaknesses.The candidate must be flexible, work independently and be able to adapt to the changing organization and regularly contribute to strengthening controls, improving risk management, and providing solutions to senior management by identifying and understanding key risks facing the organization.Preferably logistics industry knowledge, however not compulsory.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 35+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 8,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleWe’re looking for a motivated individual to join our Rev-advance: Executive Associate Track. You’ll work alongside a current executive who’ll serve as your mentor and give you unique, high-level insights and experience while you support them to drive efficiencies and achieve their goals.Gain hands-on experience, develop professionally, and receive mentorship from key decision-makers. You’ll rotate between departments to see how different teams operate and influence real-world decisions. You’ll also have the opportunity to travel to meet other Executive Associates around the world.The Rev-advance: Executive Associate Track is your fast track to promotion. After 18 months on the programme being mentored by executives, you'll open a path to an amazing career, and increase your chances of stepping swiftly into lead positions.So if you’re ready to jump-start your career and gain unparalleled experience alongside brilliant minds in the fintech industry, apply today.What You’ll Be DoingLeading high-priority projects for Revolut’s ExecutivesProactively identifying problems, carrying out analysis, designing solutions, and executing themLearning and developing skills through a blend of mentorship, hands-on experience, and independent learningGain insights into building a business and mastering problem-solvingCollaborating with other programme participants to solve company-wide problems and present proposals to executivesEngaging in quarterly events around our global offices to share ideas and learn from other programme participantsWhat You'll Need1–3 years of work experience in a fast-paced environment, such as a start-up, strategy consultancy, or investment bankA degree in a STEM, computer science, or equivalent quantitative field of study from a top universityFluency in English with excellent communication skillsExpertise in SQL or other coding languagesA solid track record of achievementA hyper-logical, structured mindset that’s results-focusedTo be resilient, curious, and passionate about making an impactThe ability to quickly assume responsibilitiesAn organised and methodological approach to problem-solvingStrong interpersonal skillsBuilding a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoDesde LHH seleccionamos para filial aseguradora de Banco catalán líder en España un/a especialista de contabilidad IFRS9/IFRS17.Misión: Participar en el ciclo contable de la compañía, implementando mejoras en los procesos y circuitos contables y en la implementación de controles, así como en el análisis posterior de las distintas magnitudes de los estados financieros.Funciones:•Diseño de procesos y circuitos en el ciclo contable de la compañía.•Implementar nuevos sistemas y procedimientos que mejoren el control del dato contable y la eficiencia de la ejecución.•Diseño y mejora de la primera línea de defensa en el control de la información contable que asegure la trazabilidad y la integridad de los registros contables.•Reporting contable mensual de los distintos negocios/productos que permita su análisis de gestión económica y financiera.•Coordinar el proceso administrativo de las operaciones de cobros y pagos, con el fin de realizar su registro y contabilización y garantizar el cumplimiento de la normativa.•Elaboración de los estados contables.•Implementar los próximos cambios normativos contables derivados de la normativa contable internacional: IFRS9 / IFRS17•Seguimiento y coordinación de los procesos de auditoria.•Garantizar el cumplimiento de las obligaciones fiscales.•Preparación de información para la auditoría financiera.•Elaboración de reports financieros para la Dirección.Requerimientos:•Licenciado en Ingeniería, Economía, ADE, matemáticas o similar.•Nivel avanzado de herramientas ofimáticas de soporte para el trabajo: Excel (hojas dinámicas, macros), Access.•Conocimientos en gestión de bases de datos.•Experiencia de al menos 3 años en Departamentos financieros, Control de gestión o similar.•Experiencia en el sector asegurador, financiero o consultoría financiera.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoYour work days are brighter here.At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.About The TeamThe Workday Success Plans Team are all about our customers and their post Go-Live journey. We create programs to help them drive business value from their Workday applications. We deliver a variety of programs and services to our customers ranging from feature demonstrations to full feature deployments.At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too! We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.About The RoleKey Areas of Responsibility:Thoughtfully recruit, develop, manage and retain a diverse, remote team of consultants supporting Workday’s applications.Promote a team-orientated, challenging and innovative work environment.Maintain and continuously improve the consulting on-boarding, performance management and career development process.Collaborate with the Resource Manager, Sales and Engagement Managers to effectively staff engagements and build the appropriate skills necessary among Workday consulting resources to ensure project success.Drive team and individuals to achieve high customer satisfaction levels.Ensure the consultants are adhering to the activities, processes and procedures outlined in Workday’s Implementation Methodology.Administer consultant incentive compensation plansContribute to the strategic direction of the Professional Services organization through leading and participating in internal initiatives.Conduct discovery activities to understand customer requirements, timeline and scope to accurately estimate projects in one or more of the following functional areas (HCM, Benefits, Compensation, HCM Security, Learning, Performance, Recruiting, Talent or Payroll)Deliver the full suite of service offerings designed to assist customers toward self-sufficiency including but not limited to:Feature Adoption WorkshopFunctional ReviewHealth CheckAbout YouBasic Qualifications3+ years of consulting experience in change management or management consulting10+ years of software consulting experience on large, enterprise projects4+ years as a people manager and/or relevant experience leading an implementation team Workday certification in one or more product areas will be required as a condition of employmentOther QualificationsStrong organizational and project management skills2+ years as a people manager preferredExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsCapable of influencing and interacting with senior executives, internally and externallyCapable of leading and influencing large design meetings towards an effective and collaborative outcome;Ability to collaborate with other organizations within Workday effectivelyOur Approach to Flexible WorkWith Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

Development skills using React preferably using Material UI or Bootstrap frameworks. Experience in Cloud architecture and adoption patterns (AWS and Azure are the most relevant) Experience working with senior stakeholders to carry out requirements analysis and definition, contributing to a well refined product backlog. Familiar with continuous delivery and tools (e.g. Octopus Deploy, ADO Pipelines) Good knowledge of distributed systems at backend with a proven track record in Performance, Scalability, and Resiliency. Agile delivery experience, especially around discovering requirements and story splitting. A good understanding of testing approaches (e.g. TDD) and putting testability at the heart of software design and development. The knowledge, experience and qualifications that will help Familiarity with chat interface development. Curiosity for AI technologies, particularly experimentation with ChatGPT, OpenAI APIs or other LLMs. Experience with containers and orchestrators such as Docker and Kubernetes.English B2/C1Valuable and desirable: being entitled of Disability CertificateKey Responsabilities Continuous delivery of exciting new feature additions to our internal AI Assistant application, drawing from our product roadmap. Develop software iteratively in close collaboration with the rest of the team with fast feedback loops, frequent releases, and a “shift-left” approach to testing. Perform triage, analysis and refinement of requirements, working closely with the Product Lead. Ensure backlog items are well refined before presenting to the rest of the development team. Manage in-house developed applications and production services to meet compliance and quality standards. Have a clear oversight on how our managed systems relate to each other, with autonomy to continuously iterate improvements to achieve highly available, fault tolerant applications. Improve reliability, monitoring and observability of services deployed within a complex, distributed technology environment (leveraging both AWS and Azure services) Develop automation techniques to simplify repetitive tasks and explore opportunities to self-heal. Participate in system design, backlog refinement, code review and application testing.What can we offer?23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurance).`Retribución Flexible´ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan…)Free access to several training platformsProfessional stability and career plansUST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments throughout the year.Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH, or remote work policy)UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discountsIf you would like to know more, don’t hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality.

titulo: Beca Sostenibilidad. Consultoría de Análisis del Ciclo de Vida (ACV)
herramientas: ['Arquitectura', 'Arquitectura sostenible', 'Arquitectura técnica', 'Capacidad de análisis', 'Consultoría', 'Consultoría de sostenibilidad', 'Emisiones de carbono', 'Energía sostenible', 'Inglés', 'Valoración del ciclo de vida']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoDesde el área de Green Deal, nuestra visión es un mundo en el que las empresas e instituciones sean más eficaces, sostenibles y tecnológicamente avanzadas, y trabajamos con ellas para mejorar su gestión, optimizar el uso de recursos y proteger el capital ambiental, que es de todos, con un enfoque global e integrado. El equipo de Energía Sostenible ofrece un servicio de consultoría y asesoría en la mejora del rendimiento energético de los activos de nuestros clientes. Está formado por un equipo de 40 profesionales, multidisciplinar, participando en proyectos a nivel nacional e internacional.  NTT DATA es una compañía que ofrece beneficios sociales, flexibilidad horaria, así como modalidades de teletrabajo. Oportunidad para participar en proyectos de Consultoría de Sostenibilidad, aplicada especialmente en la realización del Análisis del Ciclo de Vida (ACV), trabajos que son requeridos para cumplimentar las certificaciones BREEAM, LEED, WELL, I. Para ello se le instruirá en el manejo de la herramienta, además de formación para la realización de los informes necesarios. El puesto podrá requerir la visita a edificios en obra o existentes con el objetivo de hacer toma de datos de aspectos constructivos y de instalaciones para la realización de otros trabajos complementarios al ACV.Formación técnica: Ciclo Formativo de Grado Superior – Arquitectura Técnica o Arquitectura Técnica Superior. Se requieren conocimientos generales sobre edificación, en fase de diseño de proyecto, construcción, etc., para que los contenidos y temáticas a tratar en los procesos de certificación sean entendidos. Igualmente, se considera positivo que el candidato esté familiarizado con los conceptos básicos del ACV (Carbono embebido, operacional, DAPs, etc). Nivel de inglés: Mínimo B2. En NTT DATA creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad. #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique.
