descripcion: Acerca del empleoClarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing social impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions. We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse, who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide. Clarity AI is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help us develop and deploy our NLP models at scale, so that we can continue to deliver the best quality sustainability data to our customers and partners. Machine Learning models are an integral part of Clarity AI’s strategy to provide transparent, accurate, consistent and high coverage metrics for impact investing, as efficiently as possible.This is an opportunity to join a team of talented and passionate Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers based in the UK, Europe and USA, working on models that have already demonstrated tremendous value in our products.Location The role is based in Spain, and can be fully remote.Way of Working: Remote or Hybrid Key ResponsibilitiesWorking as a Machine Learning Engineer you will be responsible for:Developing NLP models and pipelines to continue to improve our data and products.Working as part of a team using best practices (Git, CI/CD).Keeping up to date with the latest developments in NLP and MLE.Developing components of complex systems.RequirementsA relevant Master/ PhD. At least 2 years of experience at a similar position.Excellent oral and written English communication skills. (Minimum C1 level-proficient user) .Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about ML and NLP.The intellectual curiosity to keep learning new things.The honesty and integrity to know what you know and admit what you don’t.The ability to clearly advocate for a particular approach, and explain why.A tech stack that includes some or all of: Python, cloud (AWS), Git, CI/CD, containerization, DAGs, APIs, ML platforms, Deep Learning frameworks.Experience with Deep Learning NLP models in production is a plus.A Git profile that shows off your capabilities and interests is highly appreciated.BenefitsESOP / Phantom Stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity AI. That's why we allow them to participate in our success with ESOP or Phantom stock options. Empowered Learning: We value continuous learning development and allocate an annual training budget to support your professional growth. Premium Health Insurance: We provide access to one of the top health insurance plans in the market, powered by Cigna. Wellness and Fitness (Gympass): Access to your preferred and your favorite gyms and studios - as well as online live fitness classes, health & wellness apps, and virtual personal training sessions. Flexible Work Arrangements: We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options. For our hybrid work set-ups, we have offices in Madrid (complete with healthy food options and monthly office events), New York City, London, Paris, Riyadh, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces. Our CultureAt Clarity AI, we are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible. To learn more about working with us, please check out our LinkedIn page and visit our website. More about Clarity AIClarity AI’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur recognised as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by excellent leadership from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences. As well as teams of professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools. Clarity AI has received several awards: Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 The Forrester New Wave Leader: ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca MinguelaClarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe are ODILO: a fast-growing edtech company with a mission to democratize access to high-quality education and provide educational technology solutions to help our users reach their full potential.Through our solutions, we provide access to millions of digital content items from the world's best providers and, using educational technology and Artificial Intelligence, enabling any organization to create its own unlimited learning ecosystem.Currently, more than 4,500 institutions (governments, schools, libraries, universities, companies, and startups) place their trust in Odilo, providing access to their unlimited learning platforms to more than 149 million users in over 50 countries.Our team is truly international (19+ nationalities) with the best talent across the education, media, content, and technology sectors.As a QA Automation Engineer, you will code, execute and maintain automated testing scripts. In this role, the Automation Engineer will collaborate with the Development and DevOps teams, defining expectations and modifications in the software to help prevent and fix quality problems.We are working on achieving a critical mission: Creating equality in education by making the highest quality digital content seamless, accessible, and affordable to all.Help everyone reach their full potential by providing personalized and intelligent unlimited learning experiences during their whole life.What you will do at ODILO:Design, develop and execute automated tests.Execute automated tests on the local environment and CI server.Develop standards and procedures using automation testing to ensure product quality and release readiness.Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans, test cases, and test reports for automated testing.Drive innovation and streamline overall automated testing processes.Discover, analyze and document defects and risks in the products.Design and execute regression and manual tests, if needed.The ideal candidate will bring:BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.Proven work experience in software development companies.Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes.3+ years of experience in automated testing.Proven work experience with tools such as Selenium WebDriver or Cypress.Good skills in coding with Java, JavaScript or Python scripting.Experience with Git, Cucumber, JMeter, Postman, Junit, TestNG or Maven.Strong ability to communicate complex problems across business teams.Be a team player and have a strong desire to solve problems, result oriented.Positive attitude and ability to solve problems autonomously.What would make us happy:Good English, written and spoken.Experience with performance, load and/or penetration testing.Knowledge of DevOps tools such as Kubernetes, Docker and Jenkins.Experience with low code testing platforms.ISTQB Test Automation Engineer or related certification.Why ODILO?Working at Odilo is about being part of a lifelong learning culture, where everyone has the possibility to take on challenges and participate in the growth of the company.But we also offer:A fast moving and challenging job within a mission driven company in an international, creative, and ambitious work environment.Unlimited learning with Odilofy, our platform with more than 3 million contents in all formats (books, audiobooks, learning experiences, movies, courses...)Emotional wellbeing services: psychologist and emotional wellbeing app.Possibility of team sports activitiesFlexible Compensation Plans: Food, Transportation, Childcare, Training and Health insurance.A salary commensurate with track record and experienceReal opportunities for internal professional development.…And more!Sounds like a mission made for you? Then we need to talk!

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¡En Ayesa crecemos juntos/as!Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros/as, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos/as somos más de 11.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países. ¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo!Si eres una persona con vocación por la tecnología y quieres continuar con tu desarrollo profesional, a la vez que concilias tu vida profesional y personal… ¡Este es tu sitio!En esta ocasión buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Ingeniero/a de datos Azure Databricks + Bases de datos que quieran continuar construyendo el futuro con nosotros/as desde 📍 Madrid¡Anímate a dar el salto! ¡Te estamos esperando!Funciones:Para incorporarse a un equipo para el desarrollo de procesos y soluciones de ingesta o tratamiento de datos con Databricks.Tecnologías:• Azure SQL• Azure Data Lake • Databricks• Python• DevopsDeseable: Conocimientos en ingesta streaming. Eventhubs, AMQStreams, Kafka¿Qué te ofrecemos?¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! El Programa “Desarróllate en Ayesa” te ayudará a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente.Contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, modelo híbrido de trabajo y Hotdesk (Smart Job) y jornada intensiva en verano.Uno de nuestros pilares es la actualización de nuestros/as profesionales, por ello proporcionamos formación técnica, certificaciones y formación en idiomas.¿Quieres encaminar tu trayectoria profesional hacia la gestión de equipo? Ayesa Management Program nos ayuda a identificar tu talento.Proceso de revisión salarial anual.Plan Familia.Plan Ayesa Bienestar 360 con descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más!Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, y en concordancia con lo dispuesto en los RD 901/2020 y 902/2020, de 13 de octubre, la empresa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso. Adicionalmente, en Ayesa apostamos por la igualdad de oportunidades y por la integración laboral de personas con diversidad funcional.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescripción de la empresaDevoteam is a leading European consultancy focused on digital strategy, technology platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation through technology.Technology is in our DNA and we believe in it as a lever capable of driving change for the better, maintaining a balance that allows us to offer our client portfolio first class technological tools but always with the proximity and professionalism of a team that acts as a guide along the way.  Descripción del empleoDevoteam is a leading European consultancy focused on digital strategy, technology platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation through technology. We currently have more than 10,000 employees internationally, based in 18 countries. We have 25 years of experience in both local and international markets and more than 2000 satisfied customers. Find out more about Devoteam Spain here.At a technological level, we focus on 6 areas of specialisation, addressing the strategic challenges of our clients: Digital Business & Products, Data-driven Intelligence, Distributed Cloud, Business Automation, Trust & Cybersecurity & Sustainability enabled by digital.Devoteam G Cloud, Devoteam's Google Cloud solutions team, is a certified Managed Service Provider (MSP) and we are proud of our 8 Google Cloud Specialisations: Infrastructure, Machine Learning, Work Transformation - Enterprise, Application Development, Training Infrastructure, Training Data, Cloud Migration & Data Analytics. Devoteam G Cloud has 780 certifications in EMEA, 240 of them achieved in the last year (more than 100 in Iberia alone).In 2023, for the fourth consecutive year, Devoteam G Cloud has been recognised as Partner of the Year in EMEA for our outstanding achievements, selling Google Cloud products and building relationships to help transform our customers' businesses. In addition, at the 2022 Google Next Spain we were recognised as Partner of the Year locally.Our goal is to be the partner of choice for teams and technology creators in their quest for sustainable success. We guide our customers on their journey to the cloud and support them with our knowledge and experience, so our customer can focus on their business while we take care of the IT. Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team with experience in Cloud solutions?Take advantage of this unique opportunity to work for strategic, world-leading projects and customers. Take advantage of all our learning and certification opportunities. Work with renowned clients, as well as helping startups grow and shine in the tech world. And, of course, be sure to block out your schedule for fun team activities.  RequisitosWe are looking for a Google Cloud Data Engineer for an international team of data engineers.Duties and Responsibilities:Design, build and maintenance of ELT pipelines in Google Cloud.Design and implementation of logic for SQL data transformationsDeployment of infrastructure as codeContinuous integration and delivery (CICD) of product increments Development of data products within Agile teamsDocumentation of developed projects and proactive sharing of technical knowledge.Required Qualifications:Experience with Google Cloud services, especially BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Cloud Build, Workflows, Pub/Sub and Cloud Run.Advanced SQL knowledgeEnglish level B2 or higherPreferred Qualifications:Experience with Terraform, Dataform, Python, version control software (git) and Github.Google Cloud certificationsOther certificationsThe position is 100% remote from Spain and the incorporation is immediate.  Información adicionalPermanent contracts.Measures to reconcile work and family life: flexible working hours, intensive working hours on Fridays and during the summer months, spatial flexibility measures, aid and administrative procedures for maternity and paternity leave, participation in training activities, etc.).Access to the Flexible Remuneration Plan (Medical Insurance, Childcare Vouchers, Restaurant Ticket, Transport and Training Card).Free physiotherapy service at the head office.Assignment of a HRBP who will accompany you throughout your career, to support your professional and personal development during your service.English classes.Resources for Devoteamers (offers discounts to employees on purchases of goods, ticket bookings, travel, etc.).The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, for the promotion of its employees on the basis of their merits and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity and equality contribute to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organisation, contributing to the advancement of society. All our positions are open to all.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoFrom Hays we are looking for a Financial Engineer to join a company operating in the quantum computing sector in San Sebastian, Basque Country.Mission of the position:You will collaborate with clients to identify the effective application of the company's technologies in solving financial problems. This includes providing guidance to the team to ensure the application of financial principles, contributing to innovation in financial solutions through the use of quantum technologies and machine learning, and working closely with clients from different sectors.Roles and responsibilities:- Collaborate with clients to apply the company's technologies to solve financial challenges.- Provide guidance to engineering teams, ensuring the application of financial principles.- Innovate and develop solutions using quantum technologies and Machine Learning.- Work with Fortune-500 clients in a dynamic start-up environment.- Invent novel approaches to address open problems in finance.- Conduct case studies for leading financial institutions.Requirements:- Master's degree in Financial Economics or Financial Engineering; alternatively, Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research or Mathematics and significant work experience in Financial Engineering fields.- Advanced knowledge of Python.- Knowledge of financial theory.- Understanding of standard derivative valuation models and numerical methods.- Familiarity with model development using Tensorflow or Pytorch.- Ability to work with experts from different professional backgrounds, both in person and through online resources.- Knowledge of quantum physics or quantum computing.- Perfect command of the English language.Experience: - Have experience in the use of machine learning algorithms or statistical models in finance.- Relevant work experience in quantitative finance.- Demonstrated competence in the use of git, unit testing, and docker.- Possess previous work experience in finance, preferably in trading or portfolio management.Benefits:- Permanent contract.- Equal pay guaranteed.- Recruitment bonus.- Relocation package (if applicable).- Private health insurance.- Hybrid work opportunity.- Flexible working hours.- Holidays: 23 working days plus 14 public holidays (2024).- Language classes and discounted lunch options.- Professional career plan. descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Eres únic@?Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.La tecnología está transformando radicalmente el mundo empresarial. En KPMG ayudamos a las empresas y a la sociedad a responder a los desafíos de la nueva era de disrupción, y nos anticipamos a las tendencias desde el conocimiento, la innovación y la inversión en tecnología.z¿Estás acabando la carrera? ¿Te gustaría tener una experiencia de prácticas inolvidable? ¡Comenzamos nuestro programa de prácticas dirigido a talento STEM para Marzo 2024!¿Qué ofrece nuestro programa de prácticas?KPMG Tech Program está diseñado para tener una experiencia única aprendiendo en un entorno liderado por la innovación y la transformación digital. Tendrás la oportunidad de elegir el área que más te interese para poder hacer de ésta una experiencia inolvidable, en la que aprenderás en un entorno tecnológico de la mano de los mejores profesionales, en proyectos internacionales y enriquecedores, con el mejor ambiente laboral.La innovación, la tecnología, la digitalización, el análisis masivo de datos...están presentes en muchas de las soluciones que ofrecemos a nuestros clientes. Los principales departamentos donde tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollarte:Technology EnablementIT StrategyCiberseguridadPrivacidadGovernance, Risk and ComplianceCustomer & GrowthLighthouseEl proceso de selección se realizará en formato presencial en el mes de enero en Madrid.¿Qué perfiles pueden participar?Estudiantes de Grado STEM o Máster STEM (Ciencias, Tecnología, Ingenierías o Matemáticas), con interés por el mundo IT y las nuevas tecnologías.Posibilidad de firmar un convenio con la universidad a partir de marzo 2024. No es necesario tener disponibilidad a jornada completa, ¡tenemos flexibilidad para que puedas compaginarlo con tus estudios!Pensamiento analítico y estratégico, capacidad de resolución de problemas y diligencia, autonomía y proactividad.Y sobre todo, ganas, ilusión y pasión por crear impacto y mejorar el mundo con tu trabajo.Si crees que el Tech Program es para ti, no lo dudes, ¡Te estamos esperando!¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficinaOportunidades internacionales y red de contactos globalFormacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medidaSalario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible31 días laborables de vacacionesLa tarde de tu cumpleaños libreFlexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajoAcceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promocionesLos beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas.Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoSi para ti las personas son lo primero y te apasiona el mundo de los RRHH, ¡Te estamos buscando!La firma de Claire Joster Selection del Grupo Eurofirms se encuentra en pleno crecimiento. Necesitamos, para nuestro equipo situado en Valencia, buscamos un/a Consultor/a de Selección que se encargue de gestionar todo el proceso de selección de perfiles técnicos y de middle management para nuestros clientes.Funciones principales:Prospección del mercado y captación de nuevos clientes.Recoger las necesidades por parte del cliente, publicación y búsqueda del candidato idóneo para el puesto requerido.Realizar las entrevistas en las que se llevará a cabo un análisis de perfiles, desde un punto de visto técnico, competencias personales y encaje de cultura y valores con respecto al cliente.Realizar la interpretación de las pruebas de evaluación.Redactar los informes de las personas candidatas y presentación al cliente.Acompañar a la persona candidata durante todo el proceso de seguimiento y soporte con el cliente.RequisitosIndispensable tener experiencia en RRHH, especialmente en procesos de selección.Experiencia en labores comerciales y de venta consultiva.Disponer de estudios finalizados en Psicología, Relaciones Laborales, RRHH o similar.Que seas una persona cercana, humilde, con habilidades comunicativa, capacidad de negociación y gestión del tiempo.Castellano hablado y escrito nivel alto. Muy valorable inglés.Beneficios sociales2 días de teletrabajo a la semana1 Tarde libre a la semanaFlexibilidad horariaSi estas interesado/a en esta posición, el mundo de los Recursos Humanos es tu pasión, y entre tus valores, se encuentran la transparencia, respeto y responsabilidad, no dudes en inscribirte, y pronto nos pondremos en contacto contigo.No esperes más y contáctanos.¡Te esperamos!
ubicacion: Valencia/València, Comunidad Valenciana / Comunitat Valenciana, España

herramientas: ['Amazon Redshift', 'Análisis espacial', 'Ciencias de la computación', 'Demostración de productos', 'Google BigQuery', 'JavaScript', 'SQL', 'Sistemas de Información Geográfica', 'Snowflake', 'Snowflake cloud']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoEverything happens somewhere - which is why spatial analytics is fundamental to companies trying to understand the “where” and the “why” of their business. CARTO is the leading cloud-native location intelligence platform, trusted by data scientists, data analysts and developers from companies such as T-Mobile, Mastercard, NHL, Coca-Cola and Gap to provide geospatial insights for use cases such as site selection, geomarketing, route optimization, network planning and much more.With an exceptionally diverse team of 170 people spread across the US and Europe, CARTO (backed by Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, among others) is changing the way companies analyze location data - making it simple to do this straight out of modern, cloud data warehouses. Redefining its category, the company has grown rapidly in recent years, providing a compelling alternative to legacy GIS software.We are looking for a growth-focused, and results-driven Customer Success Engineer to work with CARTO’s most strategic customers to use location intelligence to solve their high-impact business needs. Our Customer Success Team ensures clients adopt and see value with CARTO. Our aim is to be trusted advisors to our customers – helping solve business problems with CARTO solutions, managing accounts, and ensuring that customers love CARTO. This is a remote role and a advance level of Spanish and English is required.You will :Provide support on technical inquiries to our (GIS) customers through our support channels for our customers in AmericaAnalyze, triage and discuss with product management, engineering and design team members about providing clarity to our customers regarding their inquiriesDevelop technical examples for our customers and provide first-hand technical support, driving a high-impact resolutionProvide product demonstrations and share best practices with our customersPresent on technical topics related to the product, data, or GIS methods to the larger CARTO community and customer communitySupport the Customer Success Manager in building solutions using the CARTO productProblem solve to remove any blockers with advanced and complex use casesBe available to on-call requests for agreed shiftsYou offer:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Geography, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, GIS, or a related field2+ years of product support, professional or customer service experience in a similar position, supporting similar responsibilitiesProficient in modern cloud computing technologies, specifically Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft AzureExperience with Spatial Analysis using SQL in modern warehouses like BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, and DatabricksFamiliarity with different databases and data warehouse solutions (BigQuery, Snowflake, PostgreSQL) and with cloud ecosystems and infrastructure (Google Cloud, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes)Fluent in SQL and experience in at least one of the following languages: Python, JavaScriptExperience in the GIS ecosystemExperience troubleshooting issues of different or mixed nature from scratch and finding ways to reduce the severity of issues through alternative paths and coordinating with different internal stakeholders to meet our customers' expectationsFluent EnglishAutonomy, curiosity, eagerness to learn, and good energyWe offer:Competitive compensation.Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment.Excellent benefits, including 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees.Generous—really generous—time off, 401k with match, and stock options.Growth prospects at a truly welcoming, multicultural and multilingual company.A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we’re sharing it with the world.To ApplyDo you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO, we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, age, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq). Not the right job for you? Take a look at the rest of our openings at carto.com/careers

descripcion: Acerca del empleo🚗🚨Do you think that the automotive is your sector and also you love developing yourself as a R&D Governance Engineer?🚨🔌We are seeking a highly skilled R&D Governance Engineer to join our team in Barcelona to work with one of the major providers of components and products for the automotive sectors worldwide, in a a very international environment impacting in teams related to high technology, mechanical, electronics and software. The ideal candidate will be responsible for establishing and maintaining effective governance processes within our Research and Development (R&D) department. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, project management skills, and a deep understanding of regulatory compliance. ¿What would you be doing in your day a day? ✨ 1. R&D processes and Governance Framework Development:Design, implement, and maintain a robust governance framework for the R&D department to ensure effective decision-making, risk management, and compliance.2. Cross-Functional Collaboration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, legal, quality assurance, and regulatory affairs, to ensure alignment with governance processes.3.Continuous Improvement:Proactively identify areas for improvement in governance processes and recommend enhancements to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.4. Risk Management:Identify, assess, and manage risks associated with R&D projects, implementing mitigation strategies to safeguard project success. 5. Regulatory Compliance:Stay abreast of industry regulations, standards, and best practices relevant to R&D activities. Ensure that R&D projects adhere to applicable regulatory requirements and internal policies.6.Documentation and Reporting:Establish and maintain documentation processes for R&D activities, including project plans, progress reports, and risk assessments. Generate regular reports for stakeholders and leadership, summarizing key R&D governance metrics and insights. ¿What do we need from you? ✨Master's degree in Engineering.Automotive engineer with minimum 5 years of experience in R&D environment.Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and compliance standards relevant to R&D activities.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across various teams and levels of the organization.Detail-oriented with a focus on maintaining high standards of accuracy and quality.And, last but not least, what do we offer? ✨  Permanent contract with Abylsen.  Salary range 40k to 50k.  Ticket restaurant.  Private health insurance + daily gas contribution.  Hybrid position. Now... ▶️ ¡TIME TO PRESS THE APPLY BUTTON! ▶️ ¡We can't wait to meet you! All our job offers are opened to the hiring of people with disabilities.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout The RoleLocation: Barcelona (Hybrid)Novartis is unable to offer relocation support for this role: please only apply if this location is accessible for you.Our Customer Engagement Platform (CEP) team is 130 members strong and has a presence in key strategic locations globally. The CEP team works across a broad range of technologies (Salesforce, AWS…) and solutions, spanning applications for internal business productivity to external applications for medical professionals and patients. With endless future opportunities in Digital Health, we are well positioned to build products that directly improve and extend patient’s lives.What does it mean to be a Sr. Quality Assurance Engineer in Novartis?In this position, you will be responsible for executing the organizations overall test methodologies and approaches within our product squads, which you will support from test perspective. In this role, you will bring industry expertise, software-testing experience, and execute in line with product development, agile and devops best practices.Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Drive the standard execution of each test phase (system, integration, functional, regression, acceptance etc.) in your product scope. Contribute to the refinement and ongoing improvement of the test management strategy for the products and squads in scope. Execution of test governance and associated standards within your product squad. Participate in all Agile ceremonies being accountable for testing assessment, provide estimation support and ensure execution on quality and time (e.g. refinement, retrospective, sprint reviews…). Ensure all test related deliverables are created to quality in line with strategy and approach. Support formal review cycles including informal review, formal review, testing sign-off and quality assurance reviews focused on continuous improvement. Utilize test environments, test data and test related tooling in accordance with CEP and Novartis standards. Collaborate with other test management experts in the overall test approach and frameworks. Collaborate with peers globally in scaling test teams, processes, and standards. Maintain alignment with CEP management in terms of strategy, process, and tooling.Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.Role Requirements 5+ years’ experience in a similar role with a shown track record as a QA Engineer 5+ years’ experience working in Agile projects. Track experience in modern project and test management tools (e.g Jira, Xray). Business proficient in English (written and spoken) and Spanish proficient (spoken) Attention to detail: QA engineer should be able to spot minor details the systems, as well as the details that contribute to a top application. Effective written and spoken communication skills. Ability to negotiate and liaise with stakeholders. Critical thinking attitude. Adaptability to new technologies, methodologies and project requirements.Nice to have Salesforce and Agile/SAFe Certifications would be advantageous. API testing or Test Automation experience would be advantageous.DivisionOperationsBusiness UnitDATA, DIGITAL & ITWork LocationBarcelona Gran VíaCompany/Legal EntityNovartis Farmacéutica, S.A.Functional AreaTechnology TransformationJob TypeFull TimeEmployment TypeRegularShift WorkNoEarly TalentNo

herramientas: ['Microsoft SQL Server', 'Tableau']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoRENECO's mission is to implement a global conservation strategy aiming to restore and preserve the Houbara bustard populations of North Africa (Chlamydotis undulata undulata) and Asia (Chlamydotis macqueenii).To achieve these goals, RENECO has developed a multidisciplinary approach within different centers located in Morocco, Central Asia, and the Arabian Peninsula by combining fundamental and applied research.To cope with the expansion of its activities and due to the development of new conservation projects,RENECO is opening new positions giving a unique opportunity to be part of an ambitious conservation program.You will join the IT Department and you will be in charge mainly of supporting line-of-business applications and their users.Your main tasks will be:Analysis of business needs (breeding, veterinary, ecology) and writting of functional specificationsPropose appropriate solutions in line with the company strategyOptimization of Intranet business applications (data typing, management of technical term dictionaries, definition of input forms, configuration by back-office and under SQL Server) in close collaboration with service providers and partners.Maintenance and occasional development of legacy business applications, under AccessConsolidation of data from different production centers and BI/dashboarding (Tableau)Interfacing line of business data with those of department other than breeding/ecology: GIS (ESRI), ERP (Exact), BMS (WebCTRL), etc.Support for data curation and extraction (querying under SQL Server and Access)Writting support documents and activity reportsTraining and assistance for internal users of the line-of-business applicationsTechnical follow up of service providersMissions to be planned internationally.Profile:Education and certifications :Master (or bachelor with experience) in agronomy, ecology, biology or in the field of breeding or equivalent field; with good knowledge of T-SQL language and SQL Server or other relational database management system.Technical Skills:SQL Server and T-SQL languageActual experience of data management / treatment (not only database administration).A good knowledge of Access and VBA is an asset.Proficient in computer use (Windows, Office, Internet, utilities…)A first experience in BI, ideally with Tableau, is an asset.IT Skills:Basic knowledge in Python (or other language) coding is a plusBasic knowledge of system and network (Active Directory, IP, DNS…) is a plus.Basic knowledge of GIS (Esri ArcGIS Pro, …) is a plus.Knowledge in descriptive statistics; basic knowledge in data mining / signal analysis are a plus.Language Skills:English required.Arabic, Russian, French, Kazakh, Uzbek, or Spanish is a plus.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoSomos SOGETI y formamos parte de la empresa Capgemini. Somos 300.000 personas en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión: LA TECNOLOGÍA. Somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, religión o estado civil, ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!Nuestro equipo sigue creciendo y queremos incorporar a un/a Delivery Manager para el área de Quality Engineering & Testing de Madrid.¿Cuál será tu rol?La gestión de proyectos y de equipos:Tendrás trato directo con cliente para gestionar los proyectos y la demanda.Colaborarás en la preventa técnica de servicios y proyectos de QA.Participarás en el diseño de soluciones, planificación y dimensionamiento de proyectos de calidad de softwre. Gestión de presupuestos.Te encargarás de la gestión y seguimiento de los equipos de trabajo, incluyendo la formación de nuev@s compañer@s y el desarrollo de planes de carrera.¿Qué necesitamos que aportes?Más de 5 años de experiencia en proyectos de Testing y/o Quality Engineering.Experiencia en la gestión de equipos: coordinación, seguimientos y evaluación.Nivel alto de inglés.Buenas habilidades de comunicación e interlocución.Deseable: experiencia en automatización de pruebas, API testing y conocimientos de entornos CI/CD y Cloud (DevOps).Disponibilidad para acudir presencialmente una vez por semana a las oficinas de Madrid situadas en la zona de Las Tablas.¿Qué te ofrecemos en Sogeti?Un ambiente en el que fomentamos el espíritu innovador y emprendedor y en el que también tenemos tiempo para divertirnos con el resto de compañer@s a través de eventos internos como teambuildings, cafés o actividades deportivas.La colaboración es clave en nuestro equipo, al igual que seguir manteniendo el buen clima que nos caracteriza.Damos mucha importancia a tu desarrollo profesional y tenemos un portal propio: “GROWIN SOGETI”, con diferentes itinerarios en los que puedes formarte y especializarte en las últimas tecnologías de Testing/Microsoft.Además, todas las personas que trabajamos en Sogeti contamos con un paquete de Beneficios Sociales añadidos al salario:- Tickets restaurante- Tickets guardería- Seguro de vida y de accidentes- 50% descuento en tu seguro médicoEste año 2023 hemos vuelto a certificarnos como empresa Top Employer, ¿quieres saber por qué? ¡INSCRÍBETE Y TE CONTAMOS MÁS!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoThe principal objective of the project manager will involve the supervision of projects within both public and private administration sectors, ensuring successful implementation of digital transformation, particularly in the context of document digitization.Key Responsibilities:Supervises the daily activities of support team members.Sets priorities for the team to ensure task completion; coordinates work activities with other supervisors.Exercises judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action.Works on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors.Requirements:Bachelor degree7 years experience in Digitalization Project Management (Document and archive management)Fluent in Spanish and English (Spanish mother tongue and English C1 minimum )Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written with team members who are around the world.Strong time management and project management skills.Desirable deep knowledge of ENI (Esquema Nacional de Interoperabilidad ) WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Quiénes somos?  More than just IT  OSP (Otto Group Solution Provider) is an IT service provider for retail and logistics with headquarters in Dresden. We live our passion for IT in an appreciative, trusting work environment. What drives us is the idea of working together as a team to achieve great things for our customers.  We rely on the personal responsibility and willingness to learn of our employees, on modern technologies and high quality in software development. Agile working, transparent decisions, a lively feedback culture and collegial cooperation make us successful.  We are active for customers inside and outside the Otto Group. With over 450 employees at several German and international locations, we have been developing flexible software and BI solutions since 1991 and are thus shaping the shopping worlds of tomorrow. We are part of the Otto Group and share a value system that focuses on responsible and sustainable action.  What will you do? You will be part of the team responsible for the cross-company "Data Supply Chain" in the Otto Group to ensure the data supply of novel, data-driven business models.You will be responsible, with your expertise, of the increasing for the usability and impact of our data platform for real-time and batch processing within the group.Together with your colleagues, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of our new, high-performance and robust BI platform in the Google Cloud for big, fast & smart data. 100% Cloud only.In addition to processing and preparing the data along its entire lifecycle in our data pipelines of data stream processing, you will also create tools & frameworks for the efficient use of the new BI platform.You will be working in an international environment with our German and Spanish colleagues.  What’s your story? You will design and develop reports using BI tools and technologies such as Power BI .Strong understanding of the stakeholder’s strategic goals and the ability to align report development accordingly.Excellent analytical skills to identify key information needed by different departments and users.Proven track record of creating reports that drive actionable insights and improve business efficiency.Proficiency in data visualization concepts and techniques to present data in a clear and meaningful manner.Strong problem-solving abilities to address performance bottlenecks and optimize report loading times.Basic developer skills in SQL (e.g. Terraform, Google Dataflow), in scalable cloud solutions based on Google or other cloud providers.Confident handling of relational databases (e.g. BigQuery ) and concepts of data warehousing and data modelling (e.g. DataVault beneficial) as well as initial knowledge of real-time technologies.You are characterized by team spirit, initiative and self-organization and strong communication skills.Fluent in written and spoken English .Curiosity, self-initiative and you like to work in a team and have fun at work !  Benefits Permanent contractFlexible working hours (you decide how to organize your day to day!)Hybrid work mode (work from home up to 80% of the time, having the rest to meet you colleagues at the office!)You will be part of a fast growing company, being part of a great teamCompetitive salaryFlexible retributionMedical insuranceAgile working methodsTraining and Development: we have a clear focus on technical innovation, but we don’t forget the personal growth!

herramientas: ['Amazon Web Services (AWS)', 'Python']
descripcion: Acerca del empleo¿Quieres asumir nuevos retos? 😎 si es así, ¡este es tu sitio!. 👇🏼👇🏼Sigue leyendo 👇🏼👇🏼En Capitole estamos ampliando nuestro equipo y para ello, queremos incorporar un/a MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER con al menos, 3 años de experiencia con AWS y Python:Requisitos: ● Conocimientos en AWS● Python (tests unitarios, construcción y empaquetado, gestión de dependencias)● Conocimiento de Programación orientada a objetos● Frameworks y Librerías, Docker● PySpark, Tensorflow, Scikit Learn, Numpy, Pandas● Diseño de Software (Patrones)● Experiencia con ETLs, para datos masivos● Experiencia con Git y flujo de desarrollo continuo● Experiencia en ecosistemas de Integración Continua (tipo Jenkins, Artifactory, etc…)● Experiencia en Sistemas Unix (manejo por consola)● Conocimientos de algoritmos de Machine Learning (modelos de Clasificación, Regresión, Clustering, etc)● Experiencia en puesta en producción de modelos de Machine LearningDeseable:● Experiencia en metodología Agile● Frameworks de documentación (MKDocs, Sphinx, Scaladoc…)Condiciones: Idiomas: Inglés B2 - IntermedioUbicación: Comunidad de MadridModalidad HíbridaHorario / jornada intensiva: 40h/semana, flexible. V Jornada Intensiva. Jornada intensiva en verano.¿Por qué Capitole?Somos geniales, pero contigo lo seremos aun más! titulo: R-181428 Senior Director Clinical Scientist – Hematology Oncology R&D
herramientas: ['Buena práctica clínica', 'Control médico', 'Datos clínicos', 'Desarrollo clínico', 'Ensayos clínicos', 'Limpieza de datos', 'Planes de desarrollo', 'Presentaciones regulatorias', 'Protocolo', 'Revisión de datos']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoAstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. We are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.AstraZeneca has a multifaceted environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build talent.Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of six scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programsThe Global Development Scientist Director is an important part of the Clinical Project Team (CPT), and Global Study Team (GST) working harmoniously and cross functionally (in a matrix environment) with other CPT & GST members, Site Management & Monitoring (SMM), field-based liaisons, and site personnel. The Senior Global Development Scientist Director and counterpart Global Development Medical Director work collaboratively in the clinical aspects underpinning a product.This includes shared responsibility with Clinical Operations team members in the planning and execution, including recruitment and delivery of a clinical study. Accountabilities include clinical support for the development and implementation of early phase AstraZeneca sponsored clinical program strategies. As such, you will provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA).The Global Development Scientist Director may also provide expert input or lead functional process improvement initiatives and provide contributions to cross-asset or cross-indication area working groups depending on the level of experience.This position demands strong collaborative communication skills, including the ability to engage with and influence a diverse range of stakeholders both within and external to AstraZeneca. The individual will operate according to the highest ethical standards in compliance with internal SOPs, local regulations, laws and adhere to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and regulatory requirements.Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team.Work cross functionally within CPT to ensure the clinical strategy is translated into the development of the study concept document, study protocol and related documents; Establish key relationships internally with clinical project teams, and externally with regulatory bodies and external service providers.Provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA).Accountable for the relevance and accuracy of clinical science underpinning of clinical study based on detailed scientific review and consultation, for the clinical and scientific leadership and integrity of protocols and/or components of clinical plans and for the delivery of final protocol and its governance approval.Lead the development of the protocol and related documents and the development and delivery of the clinical study report to meet GCP, ICH and all AstraZeneca quality standards.Lead cross functional projects to ensure the successful passage of drugs through all phases of the drug development process, or contribute to one or more elements of such a project as a technical expert.Review and interpret medical data and clinical trial data and come up with conclusionsResponsible for timely responses to investigational study sites for local ICF changes, protocol & EC/IRB questions/requests.Support the development of clinical components of regulatory and EC/IRB submission documents for instances where marketing approval is warranted. Prepare and provide input to clinical study reports (CSRs) and clinical portions of Regulatory Documents (e.g., IB, DSUR, PSUR, regulatory responses)Contribute to development and delivery of face to face or virtual investigator and supervise training Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical teamParticipate or lead as needed the review and assessment of new opportunities and ESRs.Mentor less experienced Global Development Scientist DirectorsMinimum Qualifications: BS required, PhD in a scientific field, PharmD or MD is strongly preferredMinimum of 7 years of relevant experienceSignificant Industry or Academic experience in drug development required with significant experience in malignant Haematology clinical trials strongly preferred.Sufficient technical knowledge (haemato-oncology background preferred) to be able to interact with confidence with internal and external partnerPossesses sound foundational knowledge of FDA and other major country regulations and detailed knowledge of Good Clinical Practice other regulations governing clinical research.Possesses general knowledge of 1) medical monitoring 2) Regulatory approval process in relevant countries; 3) pharmaceutical industry/R&D operations; 4) marketing and commercial fundamentals.Drug Development/Clinical Development Planning: Demonstrates a consistent track record to both independently complete, and lead peers in completion in components of sophisticated plans, related documents, appropriate methodologies, measures, analytical plans and evaluation tools.Ability to drive/contribute to protocol design, writing and implementationWorking at AstraZenecaHere you’ll have the chance to create a substantial difference to patients’ lives! With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and crafting the patient ecosystem.Next Steps? Apply now!AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.Find out more and follow AstraZeneca on: LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionProcurement Marketing Category Specialist; Experiential CategoryLocation: London, Edinburgh, Glasgow, or MadridPermanent About The RoleThe Diageo Europe Marketing Procurement team has always been a significant contributor towards Diageo productivity and growth goals and considered a trusted and respected partner internally and externally. Most recently, the Europe Procurement Team came together to review its ambition for the next 2-3 years and has a very clear strategy to exponentially increase the value it brings to Diageo, and also very importantly, how it brings that value.The new strategic priorities have been clearly identified as next generation of investment optimization, continuing to build the appropriate networks, driving a step change in customer sufficiency, enhancing digitalization opportunities, and very prominently accelerating the delivery of our ESG ambition. Diageo Europe includes the Market clusters of Great Britain, Ireland, Northern Europe, Southern Europe, Eastern Europe, MENA (Middle East North Africa) and Turkiye.Experiential Marketing includes sampling, events/roadshows and at/in home events to drive memorable engagement and experiences with consumers and value for customers. The Category Specialist Experiential Marketing will be a member of a team of Category Specialists working directly with Europe Category Managers and Global Category Managers.As a key person in our dedicated team, your focus in this role is: To apply strategic procurement excellence, through creation and deployment of Europe Category Strategy built on Diageo’s best methods, standards, and tools, to deliver procurement value and embed a cost consciousness culture that supports investment optimization in Experiential Marketing categories. Leading sourcing activities, cost modelling, contract management, supplier relationship management, supplier innovation and supplier development activity using best in class processes and ways of working.Delivery of Diageo's Society 2030 ambition.To deploy category management techniques to avoid wastage and pursue outstanding spend practices Lead and implement ongoing supplier performance initiatives through performance key performance indicators and service level agreements and application of a robust supplier review mechanism within a total contract ownership approach. Driving category excellence through execution of improve projects in line with the categories strategic objectives.Pro-actively Collaborate with partners building towards full engagement across all Europe markets Adhere to and always promote the highest standards of compliance. This includes risk management processes and contract management. Generate insights and have good commercial foresight to objectively challenge established practice to stimulate alternative thinking and influence decision-making.About YouThe following skills and experience are required:A dynamic individual with the ability to thrive in an agile and fast-paced environment while finding clarity in ambiguous situations by stimulating alternative thinking. We want you to show high levels of energy and commitment and a relentlessness in the pursuit of goals.Significant experience in Procurement, Finance, FMCG Commercial or another relevant role. Subject-matter expertise in Marketing spend categories, Experiential Marketing / Events, or other relevant areas such as C&E or PR field within an FMCG environment would be advantageous. Proven performance in projects and in cross-market teams, experience developing and carrying out category and procurement strategies, managing and negotiating with agencies/suppliers including forecasting and benchmarking.You can demonstrate consistent performance and examples of implementing projects and driving strategic change. You use industry knowledge and research to drive improvements.Strong communication skills are a key strength and you have the ability to articulate across all levels of the organization.Ability to identify and problem solve independently. Commercial competence, understanding of the business and judgment.Worker TypeRegularPrimary Location:1HQAdditional Locations :Edinburgh Park, Madrid, Onyx, GlasgowJob Posting Start Date2023-12-08

descripcion: Acerca del empleoEn ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes más de dos años de experiencia trabajando en posiciones de Ingeniero/a Procesos, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!Estamos en búsqueda de un/a Ingeniero/a de Procesos para trabajar con uno de nuestros clientes del sector de la automoción en Martorell.Funciones:Creación, monitorización y control de KPIsControl de inversiones en proyectosSeguimiento y actualización semanal de preaceptaciones y aceptaciones de instalacionesExperiencia en líneas de montajePlanificaciónAprobaciones de ÄKOSExperiencia en trabajos con documentación técnica (Revisión y realización tantos documentos económicos, técnicos, de planificación, medios, útiles y procesos…)Haber aplicado metodologías de lecciones aprendidasOpcional: Metodologías agile, 8D…¿Qué buscamos?Ingeniero mecánico, aeronáutico o industrial, con experiencia en montaje/assembly de automoción de al menos 5 años, preferiblemente.Valorable conocimiento en SAP, AVON, KVS y/o KSRM.Nivel intermedio - alto de Inglés.Valorable conocimiento medio en Alemán.Buena comunicación y proactividad.¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.Retribución competitiva.¿Quiénes somos?Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 2.900 millones de euros, contamos con 42.300 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

herramientas: ['Control de gestión', 'Facilidad de adaptación', 'Gestión de desarrollo', 'Operaciones financieras', 'Planes de acción', 'Preparación de informes', 'Quickness', 'Refinanciación', 'Resolución de incidencias', 'Riesgo de crédito']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?   La principal misión del departamento es realizar el seguimiento y análisis del cumplimiento normativo en materia de clasificación contable por riesgo de crédito y sus dotaciones correspondientes, así como la gestión de los procesos operativos correspondientes. Es un equipo dinámico, con excelente actitud y habilidades diversas. Buscamos que cada miembro del equipo sea capaz de llevar a cabo diferentes funciones, pero con suficiente profundización en algunas de ellas para que pueda acabar siendo el referente en “expertise” de las mismas.   Las tareas principales asociadas al puesto serían las siguientes:    Análisis, seguimiento y control de la clasificación contable por riesgo de crédito, con foco en el seguimiento de refinanciaciones, las provisiones asociadas para la cobertura de la expected credit loss y la pérdida por el deterioro de activos (PDA).Participación en el proyecto Risk Data Aggregation (RDA).Preparación de informes financiero de riesgos, información de mercado, reporting regulatorio y análisis ad hoc para la Alta Dirección sobre el riesgo de crédito.Elaboración de Reporting interno y externoRelación con el supervisor en ámbito morosidad y clasificación contableAuditoria (interna/ Soporte peticiones, gestión e implementación de planes de acción)Gestión de desarrollo de proyectos del área. Son los encargados de gestionar el riesgo de los clientes/segmentos asignados, realizando las actividades de análisis y seguimiento de operaciones financieras, aplicando los métodos, sistemas y herramientas para la valoración y cumplimiento de los requisitos de control de riesgo definidos de acuerdo con el marco de actuación establecido por las políticas de la entidad y la regulación externa vigente, en base a la rentabilidad/riesgo de las mismas y la conveniencia para la entidad.   Descripción del perfil: Requerimientos mínimos    Estudios universitarios o postgrados, ya sean de Estadística, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería, Informática, Economía o Administración y Dirección de Empresas.Conocimiento de programación.Nivel alto en lenguaje SAS/SQL.Nivel alto en el manejo de herramientas ofimáticas de Microsoft (Excel, PowerPoint y Word).Capacidad de elaborar presentaciones a la Alta Dirección y a los órganos de gobierno.Capacidad de tratamiento y análisis de datos.Conocimiento técnico-funcional en riesgo de crédito.Autonomía y proactividad en la asunción de responsabilidades y de mejoras.Flexibilidad a cambios en la organización del día a día, para atender peticiones urgentes.Alta calidad y robustez de los outputs de trabajo.Comunicación fluida y sintética.Capacidad y motivación para el trabajo en equipo.Nivel alto de inglés: comprensión y redacción.   Requisitos valorables:   Se valorará experiencia previa en áreas de riesgo de crédito, control de gestión, auditoría, consultoría. Competencias clave    Capacidad crítica, analítica y de síntesis. Capacidad para la resolución de incidencias y la toma de decisiones rápidas (equilibrio reflexión / rapidez).Alta calidad y rigurosidad de los outputs de trabajo.Atención a los detalles.Orientación a resultados y autonomía y proactividad en el desarrollo de las tareas asignadas, buscando las posibilidades de mejora.Flexibilidad, capacidad de anticipación y adaptación a los cambios organizativos y del entorno. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.Habilidades comunicativas para la interlocución con otros departamentos y filiales del Grupo.  Ofrecemos:  Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.Medidas de flexibilidad

descripcion: Acerca del empleoBusiness Intelligence Analyst (Tableau Expert) Madrid Spain Hybrid/Remote way of workingWould you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact? Do you enjoy working on projects that combine data and business intelligence? Are you a storyteller, familiar with the use of data and interactive visuals to translate patterns and insights into creative business reports?  If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!You will be responsible for the modeling and consumption of Data using MySQL and/or any other data sources.You will collaborate on the creation of Tableau Use Cases, cooperating with the stakeholders to deliver impactful dashboards.You will interact with the customer to get the functional requirements and translate them into technical ones.You will be responsible for the maintenance of the data models in Tableau following best practices and standards across the industry.You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards in Tableau, including design, implementation, testing, security level, and data modeling.You will interact with the stakeholders to detect and solve issues or needs related to the platform.Your profileYou have a bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications or Computer Engineering, and at least 2 years of experience with Tableau, preferably within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working on projects related to digital transformation & analytics, so the Tableau Platform holds no secrets for you, making you familiar with:Configuration and maintenance of the connection gates and administration of licenses, users, and workspaces.You manage the functionalities of Tableau such as data preparation, data views creation, and data visualization.You have experience with the creation of dashboards, stories, and optimization of workbook performance.You know forecasting data and predictive modeling using Tableau.You know how to model, cleanse, and ensure the quality of data, keeping control of missing data, mistakes, inconsistencies, or inadequacy.You have participated in the designing of models for analytical data exploitation according to the functional requirements while following good corporate practices and adapting to different levels of normalization.Experience working with agile methodologies.Tableau certifications and experience with other BI tools will be highly valued.You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environments you are required to join. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English.What is in it for you?When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification.Shape your world and achieve togetherWe want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.About FujitsuSince being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers. More information: www.fujitsu.com

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout The RoleWe are looking for a Technical QA Engineer with an IT skill-set to join our QA team. The position involves testing and quality control of the platform that was built to help IT and MSP teams efficiently manage, patch and support all endpoints. Our team is steadily growing and we are seeking a specialist who can work and control the quality of remote access applications and monitoring systems for hardware and computer networks.This full-time position involves a wide IT knowledge base but it is not necessary to possess it at the expert level since we already have a close-knit team that is ready to help at any time.Location- Madrid, SpainWhat You'll Be DoingIT Expertise: Dive deep into our suite of products and emerge as an in-house expert on IT software solutionsTesting & Troubleshooting: Undertake comprehensive software testing, spotting inconsistencies and conducting troubleshooting to guarantee impeccable feature releasesDocumentation: Prepare detailed reports on the quality and functionality of software applications after thorough testingContinuous Improvement: Proactively suggest enhancements to current testing methodologies, tools and processes and continually refine our QA practicesCollaboration: Actively collaborate with product managers, developers and other stakeholders throughout the software development life cycle, ensuring that quality standards are met at each stage.About YouOperating System experience (Windows/ Mac/ Linux)Experience with virtualization - any 'Type' hypervisors (VMWare Workstation, VMWare Fusion, VirtualBox, Parallels)Experience with computer networks and network equipment (setup and management)Understanding of network hardware TCP/IP protocol understanding (especially SNMP, TCP, UDP, ICMP, DNS)Experience of using Postman (or any other API platforms)Ability to collect and analyze information from log files Experience with remote control tools (TeamViewer, Splashtop, AnyDesk, ConnectWise)Ability to use cmd/ PowerShellBasic knowledge of OSI layersOS Windows and Mac at administrator level (optional)Win Servers and any Linux distributions (optional)Configuration and working with network equipment, including Cisco, Juniper, HP and others (optional)Type 1 hypervisors (ESXi) (optional)Active Directory (optional)About UsNinjaOne is a leading unified IT operations solution that simplifies the way IT works. With NinjaOne, IT teams can automate, manage, and remediate all their tasks within one modern, intuitive platform, improving technician efficiency and user productivity. NinjaOne supports over 10,000 IT departments and managed service providers around the world and is consistently ranked #1 for its world-class customer support. NinjaOne has been recognized as the best-rated software in its category on G2 and Gartner Digital Markets for the past 3 years. Learn more about NinjaOne here: www.ninjaone.comWhat You’ll LoveOur flexible working hours with hybrid office options enable you to successfully balance your personal life and your jobGrow personally and professionally with one of the fastest growing companiesAccess to our Corporate Benefits Platform (with discounts for brands such as Expedia, FitX, Zalando and many more)Develop your skills through our renowned training platformReceive competitive compensationCollaborate with a curious, kind, international and intercultural workforce Are you already interested? We would love to get to know you! Follow the link and submit your application. We can’t wait to see you at NinjaOne.
